commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url"

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url".

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: Icc0060e5df9dc3d0bc6a29fc8249ed3b37435b9d

commit_message:
nova: add parameters to configure nova::cron::archive_deleted_rows

This patch adds new parameter to configure the crontab in charge of
archiving the deleted rows in Nova database.
The defaults were hard coded but now our operators can override it.
New parameters:
  NovaCronDBArchivedMinute
  NovaCronDBArchivedHour
  NovaCronDBArchivedMonthday
  NovaCronDBArchivedMonth
  NovaCronDBArchivedWeekday

Note: the default didn't change for backward compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #1783155
Change-Id: I786179e1604ccf192826b012992cc88dacdd2b87

commit_message:
Stop manually copying sahara-dashboard config files

RDO review https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/14081/ changed the
locaction of the config files for the openstack-sahara-ui and added the
symlinks to be more consistent with the other horizon plugins packages.
It's not necessary anymore to treat sahara-ui as a snowflake and the old
copy in horizon dockerfile must be removed.

Change-Id: Ib222809ee67d103469e9d467727e0e45eaac77e8
Closes-Bug: #1784233

commit_message:
Do not install linux-image-extra by default

In Ubuntu 14.04, the kernel shipped was lightweight, and some
extra features like using vhost_net, required the package
linux-image-extra.

In Ubuntu 16.04 and above, this is not the case anymore,
as many kernel packages ship with extra features.

vhost_net is generally shipped with the kernel package nowadays
and was the only one documented for the addition of the
linux-image-extra into our roles.

Change-Id: I579484ccefe0f29c40f8fed4b2d1b73aaeb917b1
Closes-Bug: 1783342

commit_message:
gnocchi: allow to update resources with events

We currently update resource information on each samples.

This change allows to configure Gnocchi to update resources based
on events. This have two use case:
* reduces the loads on Gnocchi
* only maintain Gnocchi resources table, while an other tools post
metric/measures (ie: collectd)

Change-Id: I91d6936abccda1b796aa1e429f3da168d996ede0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 14:37:10.000000000', 'message': 'objectstore/rgw: Add config option to support RGW implicit tenants

If "rgw keystone implicit tenants" is enabled for Rados Gateway to
enable Multi-Tenacy [1], the created RGW user IDs are in the format
"keystone_project_id$keystone_project_id", i.e. the RGW tenant ID is
added to the user ID. This breaks metering via Ceilometer as the usage
is always queried for uid=keystone_project_id. If implicit tenants are
enabled in RGW, Ceilometer has to query based on the adapted used IDs.
This commit introduces support for querying the correct user accounts.

[1] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/mimic/radosgw/multitenancy/

Change-Id: I6de4c5ce0e4f59c1d952f8fd39de64937e781280
Signed-off-by: Felix Walter <felix.walter@cloudandheat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
objectstore/rgw: Add config option to support RGW implicit tenants

If "rgw keystone implicit tenants" is enabled for Rados Gateway to
enable Multi-Tenacy [1], the created RGW user IDs are in the format
"keystone_project_id$keystone_project_id", i.e. the RGW tenant ID is
added to the user ID. This breaks metering via Ceilometer as the usage
is always queried for uid=keystone_project_id. If implicit tenants are
enabled in RGW, Ceilometer has to query based on the adapted used IDs.
This commit introduces support for querying the correct user accounts.

[1] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/mimic/radosgw/multitenancy/

Change-Id: I6de4c5ce0e4f59c1d952f8fd39de64937e781280
Signed-off-by: Felix Walter <felix.walter@cloudandheat.com>

commit_message:
Ability to define batch size off polled samples.

Currently if batch_polled_samples=True (default) then it will batch
up all samples of a poller into one message. This can be problematic
if the poller returns a large number of samples.

Change-Id: Ifc60a0cb81876f6d9054cae82ba6579707a02f67
Closes-bug: #1770310

commit_message:
Migrate to stestr for running tests

stestr is recommended by OpenStack Project Testing Interface for running tests
[1]. This change migrates to stestr for running unit tests and coverage
job. Modified `cover` env allows running it as Zuul job and visualising
its results in Gerrit.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/pti/python.html#python-test-running

Change-Id: I9e8b79d7a18cd36946daff10abb1a2f43b1aa3a1

Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

commit_message:
Grafana: Update quotes for ldap admin bind password

This encloses the ldap admin bind password in single quotes
instead of double quotes, which allows for special characters to
be successfully included in the password.

Change-Id: I57649a92595c3fe643f32dd1fb3e7c5b2a0802e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 15:20:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes ordering of environment files in a deployment plan

Sometimes making changes in basic deployment breaks the order of
passed env files and leads to a failed deployment.  This patch
orders the environment files according to the rules defined in
the capabilities-map.yaml file.

Change-Id: I4f556e5fadfe06239948624aace09f7a11ac6e7f
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes ordering of environment files in a deployment plan

Sometimes making changes in basic deployment breaks the order of
passed env files and leads to a failed deployment.  This patch
orders the environment files according to the rules defined in
the capabilities-map.yaml file.

Change-Id: I4f556e5fadfe06239948624aace09f7a11ac6e7f

commit_message:
Avoid messing arround with the sudoers file

This patch adds a simple check in the unit tests
so if the commands invoqued from sudo changes,
the sudoers file needs to be also updated.

Change-Id: Ia19ea30a1b214621ead6318b35c89e4a37f6cb0a

messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-06-28 13:38:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2018-06-28 14:12:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

4.1 is broken, as Cython is needed to translate the pyx code. Looks like that a new release will include the missing .c file:

https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/179'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-28 18:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There are some other issues with 4.x as well, see https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/187

So I reckon we need to hold on this for at least a while.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-28 19:26:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

An update from talking to one of the pyyaml maintainers: They're aware and are going to declare 4.1 no good."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-06-29 12:35:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

pyyaml 4.x was already removed from pypi for multiple reasons. We will have to reconsider this once they make a stable release.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-06 15:58:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just to report an update on the status of PyYAML:

3.13 was just released, it is a version that will work with Python 3.7 (PyYAML 3.12 did not) and has more of the correct libraries and wheels.

It does _not_ have the safe-by-default functionality. That will be coming in 4.2 ... soon?'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-07-11 16:29:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-11 19:17:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

we need to support py37 already? I don't think we support py36 yet"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-11 22:45:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

raising our requirements.txt should probably be done in another patch (as that's for the reqs repo itself), but we do need py37 support eventually as well..."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-12 06:46:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

I'm fine with doing this.

However, unlike in the past this will *NOT* propagate out to all of OpenStack.

If you want to make a consistent minimum, then you'll need to do that per repo.  I strongly suggest that effort be saved for the upcoming 4.x release in order to get the safe by default bahaviour.

I'm only +1 as I don't think it's worth updating the data files you've touched"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-14 18:33:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I'm fine with updating data (I like updating it to be close to what we have in reality)."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-16 14:41:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't think this patch does what the commit message says. It only changes the requirements file for this repo and will have no effect at all on which version of pyyaml is used in any OpenStack projects.

What is the goal of this patch?"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-07-17 08:19:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This is test data - the commit message does not align with what is being done here. if you 'actually' want to raise the minimum, then this needs to be done in the indivdiual projects meanwhile."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-25 15:19:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

procedural -2, if you wish to get this patch merged please send a feature freeze exception request (FFE) to the openstack-dev mailing list with the following tags in the email subject line.  [FFE][Requirements][$your-project-here]  Also note that you will need to explain your reasoning for requesting a FFE.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-07-30 13:16:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix usage of "|" for tests

With the more recent versions of ansible, we should now use
"is" instead of the "|" sign for the tests.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I7a5b4cf134a73e9dc6eda08c935696c5b8b8a034

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-31 12:37:33.000000000', 'message': 'Use vif.vif_name in _set_config_VIFGeneric

During IVS os-vif migration, _set_config_VIFGeneric was added:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534371/

It appears that some legacy plugging code still slipped through, since
the preferred method to pass the VIF name (i.e. device name) is via the
os-vif object. Crucially, this is not a Nova VIF object, so it has
different fields.

This change makes _set_config_VIFGeneric behave the way other os-vif
methods do, by taking the name from the os-vif object.

Change-Id: I468a9e78c948209cc2fde795ffffa0e99906fbef
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-06-01 13:57:56.000000000', 'message': 'Use vif.vif_name in _set_config_VIFGeneric

os-vif object. Crucially, this is not a Nova VIF object, so it has
different fields.

* This change makes _set_config_VIFGeneric behave the way other os-vif

commit_message:
Use vif.vif_name in _set_config_VIFGeneric

During IVS os-vif migration, _set_config_VIFGeneric was added:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534371/

It appears that some legacy plugging code still slipped through, since
the preferred method to pass the VIF name (i.e. device name) is via the
os-vif object. Crucially, this is not a Nova VIF object, so it has
different fields.

* This change makes _set_config_VIFGeneric behave the way other os-vif
  methods do, by taking the name from the os-vif object.
* This change adds back some VIF unit tests that would have caught this.

Closes-Bug: #1783551
Change-Id: I468a9e78c948209cc2fde795ffffa0e99906fbef
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 23:10:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix errors using multiple-nics templates w/o VLANs defined

The multiple-nics templates shouldn't require VLANs to be
defined for the networks, since the networks are delivered
on flat interfaces without VLANs. However, since no default
is defined, the templates fail if VLANs are not defined in
network_data.yaml. This change adds a default of "".

Closes-bug: 1784084

commit_message:
Fix errors using multiple-nics templates w/o VLANs defined

The multiple-nics templates shouldn't require VLANs to be
defined for the networks, since the networks are delivered
on flat interfaces without VLANs. However, since no default
is defined, the templates fail if VLANs are not defined in
network_data.yaml. This change adds a default of "".

Closes-bug: 1784084
Change-Id: I4514ac51729a3156ed263d680e23ef5292fc5fca

commit_message:
Adds ngs_switchport_mode config option to Dell PowerConnect driver

This allows the PowerConnect switches to configured with switchport
mode set to general.

Change-Id: Id9b506a043a8756393b302f304ca7432819bebd5
Story: 2002940
Task: 22932

commit_message:
Update check-all-candidacies to use the email address in the candidacy

Currently check-all-candidacies looks fro all open changes gets the
project from the candidacy file and then validates the change owner.
This isn't correct.

Leverage the ci-checks tools to validate the email address in the
candidacy and print enough helpful information for the election
officials to speed up their job.

Change-Id: I962c169d85dcfc442d00999649c46acb9c4b397a

commit_message:
Add non-voting job to check all candidates

I suggest we leave this as non-voting for this PTL election manually
verify the results.  Once we're confident we can upgrade it to voting.

Change-Id: I01ad9c76ab68e8282acb4bcc66a2eb7c57596171

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 02:08:03.000000000', 'message': "Add a new tool meant for CI to validate all files under candidates

The new tool validates the current release looks to exist ; assuming it
does it performs the following checks against every file found:

1. The file looks like an email address (currently contains an '@')
2. The email address is found in the OSF directory
3. The email address has a merged commit in the expected timeframe for a
   deliverable under the governance of the project team the candidate is
   nominating for.

While this is meant to be used in CI, the output should be reasonably
readable by a person, either official or candidate.

Change-Id: I51e80f5d185e3ef0be53fd8c9fba19338d9a049a

commit_message:
Add a new tool meant for CI to validate all files under candidates

The new tool validates the current release looks to exist ; assuming it
does it performs the following checks against every file found:

1. The file looks like an email address (currently contains an '@')
2. The email address is found in the OSF directory
3. The email address has a merged commit in the expected timeframe for a
   deliverable under the governance of the project team the candidate is
   nominating for.

While this is meant to be used in CI, the output should be reasonably
readable by a person, either official or candidate.

Change-Id: I51e80f5d185e3ef0be53fd8c9fba19338d9a049a

commit_message:
Allow get_projects to fall-back to master.

In the event that the governance repo isn't tagged we want to be able to
fall-back to master so we can still potentially validate a candidate.

Change-Id: Ie13770f92dd05a3aa79bdc85b1bb482df3f3b8f3

commit_message:
Add support for cells v2

This change adds relations necessary for registering a compute cell
with the superconductor. For a cell to be registered this charm
must have relations with the compute cells conductor, database and
message queue. Only when all these relations are complete can the
registration happen. Below are major changes included in this PR.

* Add nova-cell-api relation for communicating with the
  nova-cell-conductor
* Add shared-db-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells database.
* Add amqp-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells message queue.
* Add methods for registering cells with the
  superconductors database.
* Charm helper sync

Change-Id: I54f98c1d420b6a6b1dd8ed7dbd00a2362b584b81

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

commit_message:
baremetal: correct the default timeout in Node.set_provision_state

It should be None, which allows the client to wait until the server
side timeout. True is probably cast to 1, which is incorrect.

Change-Id: I6ae42b44b5460fed5291584576bb9eb7bcdfecb4

(8 comments)

@Slawek: Ha, Thanks very much for support. :), I tested with all agent modes, including Generic mode, HA, DVR, DVRHA. Also introduce the agent part functional test in this patch. To be honest, I'm not sure if the fullstack test could be help, as I have never wrote fullstack tests yet. :). 

And you are right, the feature lacks some tests in full deployment cases, I guess it must be a huge work, not only fullstack as you said, but also tempest(just like test qos). All of them are waiting for the function patch to be stable. So.. :)

I'm so glad to hear you will help this feature and many thanks to you. But I think the Neutron team needs you and may wants you to help the other one's patches for many contributors, as we have only several core reviewers. For this work, I will continue in recently, but I wish I could get your direction and help about this part. :). Could you please tell me the period that you ususally walk around in irc channel? :) Thanks"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-07-18 14:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

Fullstack tests are "in-tree" so it can be added even together with this patch or on top of it. That's not a problem.
It shouldn't be very hard to do such test. Base tests for testing connection with FIP are already done in fullstack, see: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/fullstack/test_l3_agent.py so it should be matter of add some new test which will be very similar to what is already done :)

I deployed PS16 of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574673 in my test environment. As you can see here, http://paste.openstack.org/show/726474/, I have 3 port forwardings in a floating IP but I don't see any entries in the router's nat table. Am I missing something?

Here's the iptables-save view of the nat table:

*nat
:PREROUTING ACCEPT [0:0]
:INPUT ACCEPT [0:0]
:OUTPUT ACCEPT [1:74]
:POSTROUTING ACCEPT [0:0]
:neutron-l3-agent-OUTPUT - [0:0]
:neutron-l3-agent-POSTROUTING - [0:0]
:neutron-l3-agent-PREROUTING - [0:0]
:neutron-l3-agent-float-snat - [0:0]
:neutron-l3-agent-snat - [0:0]
:neutron-postrouting-bottom - [0:0]
-A PREROUTING -j neutron-l3-agent-PREROUTING
-A OUTPUT -j neutron-l3-agent-OUTPUT
-A POSTROUTING -j neutron-l3-agent-POSTROUTING
-A POSTROUTING -j neutron-postrouting-bottom
-A neutron-l3-agent-POSTROUTING ! -i qg-b8561fd6-ea ! -o qg-b8561fd6-ea -m conntrack ! --ctstate DNAT -j ACCEPT
-A neutron-l3-agent-PREROUTING -d 169.254.169.254/32 -i qr-+ -p tcp -m tcp --dport 80 -j REDIRECT --to-ports 9697
-A neutron-l3-agent-snat -j neutron-l3-agent-float-snat
-A neutron-l3-agent-snat -o qg-b8561fd6-ea -j SNAT --to-source 172.24.4.11
-A neutron-l3-agent-snat -m mark ! --mark 0x2/0xffff -m conntrack --ctstate DNAT -j SNAT --to-source 172.24.4.11
-A neutron-postrouting-bottom -m comment --comment "Perform source NAT on outgoing traffic." -j neutron-l3-agent-snat
COMMIT'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-07-24 03:33:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

@Miguel, I'm not sure your configuration about neutron-server and l3-agent.
We need to enable "port_forwarding" in service_plugins of neutron.conf . Then we also add the extensions=port_forwarding in l3_agent.conf

So I guess you may miss the configuration of l3_agent. Right?'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2018-07-24 03:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

@miguel, yeah. I think you miss the configuration of l3_agent.conf .I saw http://paste.openstack.org/show/726474/ . If there is no action about iptables entries and fip status still Down, that means the agent side not do anything, it lacks a port_forwarding extension.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-07-24 07:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

> @miguel, yeah. I think you miss the configuration of l3_agent.conf
 > .I saw http://paste.openstack.org/show/726474/ . If there is no
 > action about iptables entries and fip status still Down, that means
 > the agent side not do anything, it lacks a port_forwarding
 > extension.

I can only say that I was trying it also and indeed, at first I forgot to enable extension in l3_agent.conf file. Then I added it and iptables rules were configured properly for me :)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-07-24 09:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31: Code-Review-1

'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 12:04:02.000000000', 'message': '[agent side] L3 agent side Floating IP port forwarding

This patch contains the l3 agent extension and agent part code.
This patch introduce a new l3 agent extension named "port_forwarding",
to process the binding the port forwarding resources, manage its own
floatingip configuration on router interface and floatingip status.
Currrently, we support all Neutron Router reference implementations.

This extension uses the period router sync task and PortForwarding OVO
rpc.

* The main idea about this new extension is using the generic router sync
  rpc to maintain the host port forwarding resources,
* For a single port forwarding create/update/delete, process it one by one
  and smaller scope for forbidding fresh the iptables with a large
  scope frequently.

Partially-Implements: blueprint port-forwarding
Partial-Bug: #1491317
Change-Id: Ic56e67d428f6177099c285a9d1bccabc1e710f2b

'}, {'created': '2018-07-19 11:30:33.000000000', 'message': '[agent side] L3 agent side Floating IP port forwarding

This patch contains the l3 agent extension and agent part code.
This patch introduce a new l3 agent extension named "port_forwarding",
to process the binding of the port forwarding resources, manage its own
floatingip configuration on router interface and floatingip status.
Currrently, we support all Neutron Router reference implementations.

This extension uses the period router sync task and PortForwarding OVO
rpc.

* The main idea about this new extension is using the generic router sync
  rpc to maintain the host port forwarding resources,
* For a single port forwarding create/update/delete, process it one by one
  in smaller scope for forbidding refresh the iptables with a larger
  scope frequently.

Partially-Implements: blueprint port-forwarding

commit_message:
[agent side] L3 agent side Floating IP port forwarding

This patch contains the l3 agent extension and agent part code.
This patch introduce a new l3 agent extension named "port_forwarding",
to process the binding of the port forwarding resources, manage its own
floatingip configuration on router interface and floatingip status.
Currrently, we support all Neutron Router reference implementations.

This extension uses the period router sync task and PortForwarding OVO
rpc.

* The main idea about this new extension is using the generic router sync
  rpc to maintain the host port forwarding resources,
* For a single port forwarding create/update/delete, process it one by one
  in smaller scope for forbidding refresh the iptables with a larger
  scope frequently.

Partially-Implements: blueprint port-forwarding
Partial-Bug: #1491317
Change-Id: Ic56e67d428f6177099c285a9d1bccabc1e710f2b

commit_message:
Fix usage of "|" for tests

With the more recent versions of ansible, we should now use
"is" instead of the "|" sign for the tests.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: Ia1c412489554ab629a8ffa8e385a9b634f471861

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-30 07:26:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix package name for centos

There is no python{,3}-systemd package under centos. Only
systemd-python exists.

The patch [1] merged with non-voting jobs for keystone, and
therefore has started to break all the other jobs who are voting,
like horizon.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585524/9/vars/redhat-7.yml
Change-Id: I86c43b2ce189bf25f5c3de1bba1c1231787693ba
'}]
commit_message:
Fix package name for centos

There is no python{,3}-systemd package under centos. Only
systemd-python exists.

The patch [1] merged with non-voting jobs for keystone, and
therefore has started to break all the other jobs who are voting,
like horizon.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585524/9/vars/redhat-7.yml
Change-Id: I86c43b2ce189bf25f5c3de1bba1c1231787693ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 05:44:33.000000000', 'message': "Do not check flavor.id after Microversion 2.46

flavor.id is longer included in server info after Microversion
2.46, so do not check flavor.id if 'id' is not a key of flavor.

Ref: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#rebuild-server-rebuild-action

Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api

Change-Id: Id376de39662a4799909b56ec1148c85910d95814
"}, {'created': '2018-03-30 08:54:55.000000000', 'message': "Do not check flavor.id after Microversion 2.46

flavor.id is longer included in server info after Microversion
2.46, so do not check flavor.id if 'id' is not a key of flavor.

Note: We needn't check whether 'id' is in flavor or not in
different microversions because schema check already covers it.

Ref: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#rebuild-server-rebuild-action

Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api

Change-Id: Id376de39662a4799909b56ec1148c85910d95814
"}, {'created': '2018-04-02 06:55:19.000000000', 'message': "Do not check flavor.id after Microversion 2.46

flavor.id is longer included in server info after Microversion
2.46, so do not check flavor.id if 'id' is not a key of flavor.

Note: We needn't check whether 'id' is in flavor or not in
different microversions because schema check already covers it.

Ref: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#rebuild-server-rebuild-action

Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api

Change-Id: Id376de39662a4799909b56ec1148c85910d95814
"}, {'created': '2018-04-03 02:12:42.000000000', 'message': "Do not check flavor.id after Microversion 2.46

flavor.id is longer included in server info after Microversion
2.46, so change to checking flavor info if 'id' is not in flavor.

Note: We needn't check whether 'id' should be in flavor or not in
different microversions because schema check already covers it.

Ref: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#rebuild-server-rebuild-action

Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api

Change-Id: Id376de39662a4799909b56ec1148c85910d95814
"}, {'created': '2018-04-12 02:05:26.000000000', 'message': "Do not check flavor.id after Microversion 2.46

flavor.id is longer included in server info after Microversion
2.46, so change to checking flavor info if 'id' is not in flavor.

Note: We needn't check whether 'id' should be in flavor or not in

commit_message:
Do not check flavor.id after Microversion 2.46

flavor.id is longer included in server info after Microversion
2.46, so change to checking flavor info if 'id' is not in flavor.

Note: We needn't check whether 'id' should be in flavor or not in
different microversions because schema check already covers it.

Besides, this is to make resize_server in base.py instance method,
because it's not likely to be used in resource_setup, and so we can
use assert check in it.

Ref: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#rebuild-server-rebuild-action

Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api

Change-Id: Id376de39662a4799909b56ec1148c85910d95814

Use six library to import python queue

Due to the queue module being renamed in Python 3 we need to support
both the new and the old name whilst people are still using Python 2.

Story: 2003130
Task: 23251

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 06:38:59.000000000', 'message': 'Hard link environments to keep backwards compat

As of Rocky environments/services-docker had been moved into
environments/services. For stable branches, that is a breaking change
we cannot allow for minor updates. Therefore, maintain a copy of
environments/services in hard linked environments/services-docker. The
latter is deprecated and all references to it, like in users custom
resources registries, should be gradually transitioned to the
environments/services path. That gradual migration also ensures the
smooth upgrade path from Queens to Rocky.

Softlinks would require additional complexity to make them
properly stored in deployment plans in swift. Therefore, use
hardlinks instead.

Change-Id: Ifd095a2e7e58c19311af2c4fa24b74aad56338d9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-07-27 08:00:28.000000000', 'message': 'Hard link environments to keep backwards compat

As of Rocky environments/services-docker had been moved into
environments/services. For stable branches, that is a breaking change
we cannot allow for minor updates. Therefore, maintain a copy of
environments/services (deployment-time only) put into hard linked
environments/services-docker, via the templates processing tool.

The environments/services-docker path is deprecated and all references
to it, like in users custom resources registries, should be gradually
transitioned to the environments/services path. That gradual migration
also ensures the smooth upgrade path from Queens to Rocky.

Option --retain-deprecated controls that behavior and allows to retain
the existing services-docker path intact.

Use --retain-deprecated for tox so the validation will not fail because
of the services-docker hard links created earlier by the templates
processor.

Softlinks would require additional complexity to make them
properly stored in deployment plans in swift. Therefore, use
hardlinks instead.

Change-Id: Ifd095a2e7e58c19311af2c4fa24b74aad56338d9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Hard link environments to keep backwards compat

As of Rocky environments/services-docker had been moved into
environments/services. For stable branches, that is a breaking change
we cannot allow for minor updates. Therefore, maintain a copy of
environments/services (deployment-time only) put into hard linked
environments/services-docker, via the templates processing tool.

The environments/services-docker path is deprecated and all references
to it, like in users custom resources registries, should be gradually
transitioned to the environments/services path. That gradual migration
also ensures the smooth upgrade path from Queens to Rocky.

Option --retain-deprecated controls that behavior and allows to retain
the existing services-docker path intact.

Use --retain-deprecated for tox so the validation will not fail because
of the services-docker hard links created earlier by the templates
processor.

Softlinks would require additional complexity to make them
properly stored in deployment plans in swift. Therefore, use
hardlinks instead.

Change-Id: Ifd095a2e7e58c19311af2c4fa24b74aad56338d9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Loosen docutils requirement pin

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573474 introduced a
problematic pinned requirement for docutils==0.11
which can't be supported across the various distros
that we need to support.

Change the requirement from strict equality to
greater-than-or-equal.

Change-Id: I92fcf6a516339a660395e5cd48e0a496158447e8
(cherry picked from commit 7facff7cb99966a77ab14dd46bd6030559f78676)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 21:24:48.000000000', 'message': "Use provided device paths

Ensure that device paths provided by end users are used for OSD's,
rather than the link target device as this may change between
reboots. The specific use case is bcache, where:

   /dev/bcacheX:
        changes between reboots
   /dev/disk/by-dname/bcacheX:
        udev managed and consistent

This change also ensures that any unit data is updated to switch
back to using the provided block device path, rather than the
actual target which may have been used in prior charm revisions.

Change-Id: If5e88d93b9323052ea762d3a4b66f2442d4a19be
Depends-On: If0e1fbc62bfe7d0f9e21db9bfdeee761060de846
Closes-Bug: 1782439
(cherry picked from commit 488f7dffefa2fdf9bf439d676103c0168f21d2ea)
"}]
commit_message:
Use provided device paths

Ensure that device paths provided by end users are used for OSD's,
rather than the link target device as this may change between
reboots. The specific use case is bcache, where:

   /dev/bcacheX:
        changes between reboots
   /dev/disk/by-dname/bcacheX:
        udev managed and consistent

This change also ensures that any unit data is updated to switch
back to using the provided block device path, rather than the
actual target which may have been used in prior charm revisions.

Change-Id: If5e88d93b9323052ea762d3a4b66f2442d4a19be
Depends-On: If0e1fbc62bfe7d0f9e21db9bfdeee761060de846
Closes-Bug: 1782439
(cherry picked from commit 488f7dffefa2fdf9bf439d676103c0168f21d2ea)

commit_message:
Copy-in redis certs via kolla extended/start

Instead of bind-mounting directly into the redis container,
follow the established approach for ditributing certificates
in containers.

Partial-bug: #1767998

Change-Id: Iff1a757c4893698ba550143d786088e5b9ffd714
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Copy-in libvirt certs via kolla extended/start

Instead of bind-mounting directly into the libvirt container,
follow the established approach for ditributing certificates
in containers.

Change-Id: Icdec38004df28988aa3a62019cb092c59d915f0e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use leader storage for passwords

There are no relation-level concerns for these values.

Any pre-existing deployments with recent charms (as in released
2015 or later) will have already migrated the peer storage to
leader storage, so this change can build on that work directly.

Ref: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/blame/master/charmhelpers/contrib/peerstorage/__init__.py

Change-Id: I85d1746bdf3e9d3e1ff514e6dd2b4c565dee4dfc
Closes-Bug: #1783943

commit_message:
Use leader storage for `db-initialised` flag

There are no relation-level concerns for this flag.

Any pre-existing deployments with recent charms (as in released
2015 or later) will have already migrated the peer storage to
leader storage, so this change can build on that work directly.

Ref: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/blame/master/charmhelpers/contrib/peerstorage/__init__.py

Change-Id: Ia7362d257428b102c452d0e91bcf9b3378a1e6e9
Closes-bug: #1783747

Replace references to `keystone-common` with `keystone`

The `keystone-common` package no longer exist and using it for
OpenStack release comparison will not produce expected results.

Change-Id: I263c408679759971265d721cdd66ae9ea7d481d8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-30 06:40:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove entry point configuration

The configuration options for plugin entry points is
superflous and leads to Internal Server errors on Rocky.

Remove them from configuration and have Keystone use its
defaults.

Change-Id: I460aec084478f2ead8c16a11c0731bc110197368
Closes-Bug: #1784295
'}]
commit_message:
Remove entry point configuration

The configuration options for plugin entry points is
superflous and leads to Internal Server errors on Rocky.

Remove them from configuration and have Keystone use its
defaults.

Change-Id: I460aec084478f2ead8c16a11c0731bc110197368
Closes-Bug: #1784295

commit_message:
Add policy.json to allow owner to force delete volumes

The default in cinder is to only allow the admin to
force delete a volume; this change allows the
admin_or_owner to force delete a volume.

Change-Id: Ice9d60e721d10dfe6bac1db5b5a06838088644ba

commit_message:
Setting up charm_dir() return_value on mocked hookenv
tox -e py36 fails before running any unit test for Designate-Bind Charm
TypeError happens during test discover time, where mocked hookenv.charm_dir()
is called without any return_value defined
Closes bug #1783765 with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586204/

Change-Id: I6935ad40fbc9168fa31ef90c7501ee0b873f5ba4
Partial-Bug: #1783765

commit_message:
Setting up charm_dir() return_value on mocked hookenv
tox -e py36 fails before running any unit test for Designate-Bind Charm
TypeError happens during test discover time, where mocked hookenv.charm_dir()
is called without any return_value defined
Closes bug #1783765 with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586204/

Change-Id: I1439f4c4325be5ff17c6224ef4052a306fc91ee2
Partial-Bug: #1783765

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-06 11:21:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add BIOS resource support

Simulates BIOS support for libvirt driver by storing custom
XML with BIOS attributes in libvirt Domain XML, sample:

<domain type='kvm'>
[...]
  <metadata xmlns:sushy="http://openstack.org/xmlns/libvirt/sushy">
    <sushy:bios>
      <sushy:attributes>
        <sushy:attribute name="ProcTurboMode" value="Enabled"/>
        <sushy:attribute name="BootMode" value="Uefi"/>
        <sushy:attribute name="NicBoot1" value="NetworkBoot"/>
        <sushy:attribute name="EmbeddedSata" value="Raid"/>
      </sushy:attributes>
    </sushy:bios>
  </metadata>
[...]

These values do not have any effect on VM. This is a workaround
because there is no libvirt API to manage BIOS settings.
By storing fake BIOS attributes they are attached to VM and
are persisted through VM lifecycle.

First time accessing BIOS attributes, libvirt XML is updated
with default values.

For now it supports getting attributes, updating
attributes, resetting to default.

Updates to attributes are immediate unlike in real BIOS that
would require system reboot.

This does not support changing password yet, but can be added
later.

This does not support getting attribute update status, because
this is not implemented in sushy library yet. Can be added after
this is implemented in sushy.

Openstack/Nova driver is not supported as its SDK does not
expose API for BIOS settings management.

Test structure depends and is based on other patches to be merged:
568636 and 566727.

Private method _process_bios_attributes is introduced to make
XML testable otherwise have to compare XML strings to test if
XML saved to libvirt is as expected.

Change-Id: I3b9e7683934e4448bedf3933f1a2fe222d70c208
Story: 2001791
Task: 22264
'}, {'created': '2018-07-06 15:23:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add BIOS resource support

        <sushy:attribute name="NicBoot1" value="NetworkBoot"/>
        <sushy:attribute name="EmbeddedSata" value="Raid"/>
      </sushy:attributes>
    </sushy:bios>
  </metadata>
[...]

These values do not have any effect on VM. This is a workaround
because there is no libvirt API to manage BIOS settings.
By storing fake BIOS attributes they are attached to VM and
are persisted through VM lifecycle.

First time accessing BIOS attributes, libvirt XML is updated
with default values.

For now it supports getting attributes, updating
attributes, resetting to default.

Updates to attributes are immediate unlike in real BIOS that
would require system reboot.

This does not support changing password yet, but can be added
later.

This does not support getting attribute update status, because
this is not implemented in sushy library yet. Can be added after
this is implemented in sushy.

Openstack/Nova driver is not supported as its SDK does not
expose API for BIOS settings management.

Test structure depends and is based on other patches to be merged:
568636 and 566727.

Private method _process_bios_attributes is introduced to make
XML testable otherwise have to compare XML strings to test if
XML saved to libvirt is as expected.

commit_message:
Add BIOS resource support

Emulates BIOS support for libvirt driver by storing custom
XML with BIOS attributes in libvirt Domain XML.

For now it supports getting attributes, updating
attributes, resetting to default.

This does not support changing password yet, but can be added
later.

This does not support getting attribute update status, because
this is not implemented in sushy library yet. Can be added after
this is implemented in sushy.

Test structure depends and is based on other patches to be merged:
I02725332df886fdf6b13c98cb6d80ab3650575b9 and
I82032fd13a74d9aa77616dac3802d506b4a9c1cf.

Change-Id: I3b9e7683934e4448bedf3933f1a2fe222d70c208
Story: 2001791
Task: 22264

Add support to regenerate port mac_address

- Adds converter to generate a valid mac address if the
  provided data is 'null' (None).
- Adds api extension definition for port using the new converter.

Change-Id: Ibfcf179c2051d2bf47d4d1e62e8146cbee29fd64
(cherry picked from commit 56033ba643812a30577f6ab17648806c2ee494ba)

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-07-08 08:00:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

This is a new feature. We cannot backport it according to the stable rules.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-09 06:16:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This is a new feature. We cannot backport it according to the
 > stable rules.

As described in my previous comment, this is part of fixing a very real problem that a user of a cloud exposing the baremetal service cannot recovery from without the cloud operators help. An attempt to set up a baremetal instance that fail might effectively take as multiple baremetal servers out of service. One baremetal service per scheduling retry in the worst case.

IMO we meet all 4 requirements[1] here. This is not a large change, we have test coverage in both unit test and tempest api tests that validate that we do not regress and it is part of fixing an issue with actual user impact.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#appropriate-fixes'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-07-15 05:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

I do not feel that this is appropriate for stable. A new extension is a feature.
I will not block it but it is clearly breaking the stable policies.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-07-15 06:11:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

API change is a feature: APIImpact: Port mac_addr regenerated if None passed on update.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-07-16 19:27:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree that this is not backportable based on the standards.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-07-19 18:41:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sorry for the slow reply, but would also agree the new extension isn't backportable since it changes the API."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-30 08:05:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add support to regenerate port mac_address

Passing 'null' (None) as the mac address in a port update
request causes the port's mac address to be re-generated
using the base MAC address Neutron uses for VIFs.

This change implementes a temporary lib api definition
with a new converter that will generate valid mac if the
data provided is None.

APIImpact: Port mac_addr regenerated if None passed on update.
Closes-Bug: #1768690
Change-Id: I7d04beea4810718c3b745de8ea97897b1323267e
(cherry picked from commit 8f3a066b20b7ffafec95a618d60e40727504f37c)

commit_message:
libvirt: add method to configure migration speed

In this commit we are enhancing guest object to control the maximum bw
to perform migration.

Related-Bug: #1414559
Change-Id: I35470773b8c467449ed71217fdb4b6c82f455e33
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add systemd journal logging to the service config

The systemd journal would normally be populated with the standard out of
a service however with the use of uwsgi this is not actually happening
resulting in us only capturing the logs from the uwsgi process instead
of the service itself. This change implements journal logging in the
service config, which is part of OSLO logging.

OSLO logging docs found here: <https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.log/3.28.1/journal.html>

Change-Id: I943bd5f1ac767f83d853cee09a5857f6f9f0efff
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2018-06-27 04:04:32.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote names with sgdisk

Our sgdisk calls are putting extra double-quotes around the names of
partitions.  This confuses sfdisk, which confuses growpart, which
confuses growroot ... and you don't get your partition grown for EFI
boot.

Ensure we just bunch arguments into the list directly (for Popen)
rather than string split and have to worry about quoting.  Add a check
for this to our GPT unit test, extending it to include a space in the
name of the root partition.

Change-Id: I0a8cb69bb4c9c0865fbaa63ba0d7210028da552e
"}, {'created': '2018-06-27 08:10:23.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote names with sgdisk

Our sgdisk calls are putting extra double-quotes around the names of
partitions.  This confuses sfdisk, which confuses growpart, which
confuses growroot ... and you don't get your partition grown for EFI
boot.

Ensure we just bunch arguments into the list directly (for Popen)
rather than string split and have to worry about quoting.  Add a check

name of the root partition.

Change-Id: I0a8cb69bb4c9c0865fbaa63ba0d7210028da552e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote names with sgdisk

Our sgdisk calls are putting extra double-quotes around the names of
partitions.  This confuses sfdisk, which confuses growpart, which
confuses growroot ... and you don't get your partition grown for EFI
boot.

Ensure we just bunch arguments into the list directly (for Popen)
rather than string split and have to worry about quoting.  Add a check
for this to our GPT unit test, extending it to include a space in the
name of the root partition.

Change-Id: I0a8cb69bb4c9c0865fbaa63ba0d7210028da552e

commit_message:
Add trove tempest scenario test and datastore test

Add trove scenario test: create a mysql database instance and when the
instance status is ready then check the database is all right.

Change-Id: Ia098cd126bbdf6373436e31d4020bb8a21439866

commit_message:
When no reserved_host available, disable the failure host

This patch modifies that masakari-engine disables the failed
host when no reserved_host is available. masakari-engine
creates a new taskflow, and disables by executing it.

Change-Id: I26790ae48b2941bcfd6eb74f5c66b13cc36bdeef
Closes-Bug: #1738340

As function tempest.test.services() has been moved to
tempest.common.utils.services() in Pike, currently when we run
trove-tempest-plugin we get ugly warning:

DeprecationWarning: Function 'tempest.test.services()' has moved

commit_message:
Fix deprecation warning in test_flavors.py

As function tempest.test.services() has been moved to
tempest.common.utils.services() in Pike, currently when we run
trove-tempest-plugin we get ugly warning:

DeprecationWarning: Function 'tempest.test.services()' has moved
to 'tempest.common.utils.services()' in version 'Pike' and will
be removed in a future version

Let's remove it by simply using new name of that function.

Change-Id: Ia4981c0c9eec1ae2655e25d9baba44e283b2450c
Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Opasiak <k.opasiak@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Add datastore client and API tests

Add basic data store client and API tests for:

- datastore list
- datastore show
- datastore version list
- datastore version show

Add also a configuration option to allow specifying expected
datastores and their versions.

Change-Id: I781319d54930efe1a84329d16e7c424659c52f30
Co-Authored-By: Krzysztof Opasiak <k.opasiak@samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Opasiak <k.opasiak@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Give extended privileges to the container

Co-Authored-By: Feng Shengqin<feng.shengqin@zte.com.cn>.
These codes are rewritten by mengdong(National Engineering Laboratory of electronic commerce and electronic payment) without functional change because of Windows style of codes.

Change-Id: Ibcbd0351d2acf5b3fb2b36673fe50d3d3518cdac
Implements: blueprint support-zun-create-privileged

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 09:16:12.000000000', 'message': 'Register and Document policy in code

Adds below things for the implementation of framework for registering and
using default policy rules.
* Policy-in-code
  The framework for registering and using default policy rules.
  Rules should be defined and returned from a module in
  masakari/policies/, and then added to the list in masakari/policies/__init__.py.
  A new context.can() method has been added for policy enforcement of
  registered rules. It has the same parameters as the enforce() method
  currently being used.
* Add policy sample generation
  The entry point and config file necessary for using the
  oslo.policy sample generation script. It also adds a tox target to
  simplify the usage of it.
* Add policy documentation and sample file
  Documentation and sample file for default policy in code feature.
* Hacking check for policy registration
  It ensures that policy registration happens in the centralized
  masakari/policies/ directory.
* Hacking check for _ENFORCER.enforce()
  Hacking check in order to ensure that only registered policies
  are used for authorization checks _ENFORCER.authorize should be used rather
  than _ENFORCER.enforce.
* Add entry_point for oslo policy scripts
  There are two helper scripts in oslo.policy to help deployers understand
  their policy configuration better. With the setup.cfg entry these can be
  called directly from oslo.policy.

Change-Id: If885a66d92c31be440d27d6780635800a0b12e3e

  masakari/policies/ directory.
* Hacking check for _ENFORCER.enforce()
  Hacking check in order to ensure that only registered policies
  are used for authorization checks _ENFORCER.authorize should be used rather
  than _ENFORCER.enforce.
* Add entry_point for oslo policy scripts
  There are two helper scripts in oslo.policy to help deployers understand
  their policy configuration better. With the setup.cfg entry these can be
  called directly from oslo.policy.

Changes done here are with the reference of [1] at NOVA side
which is contributed by Andrew Laski and Claudiu Belu

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/policy-in-code+project:openstack/nova+status:merged

commit_message:
Register and Document policy in code

Adds below things for the implementation of framework for registering and
using default policy rules.
* Policy-in-code
  The framework for registering and using default policy rules.
  Rules should be defined and returned from a module in
  masakari/policies/, and then added to the list in masakari/policies/__init__.py.
  A new context.can() method has been added for policy enforcement of
  registered rules. It has the same parameters as the enforce() method
  currently being used.
* Add policy sample generation
  The entry point and config file necessary for using the
  oslo.policy sample generation script. It also adds a tox target to
  simplify the usage of it.
* Add policy documentation and sample file
  Documentation and sample file for default policy in code feature.
* Hacking check for policy registration
  It ensures that policy registration happens in the centralized
  masakari/policies/ directory.
* Hacking check for _ENFORCER.enforce()
  Hacking check in order to ensure that only registered policies
  are used for authorization checks _ENFORCER.authorize should be used rather
  than _ENFORCER.enforce.
* Add entry_point for oslo policy scripts
  There are two helper scripts in oslo.policy to help deployers understand
  their policy configuration better. With the setup.cfg entry these can be
  called directly from oslo.policy.

Changes done here are with the reference of [1] at NOVA side
which is contributed by Andrew Laski and Claudiu Belu

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/policy-in-code+project:openstack/nova+status:merged

Change-Id: If885a66d92c31be440d27d6780635800a0b12e3e

commit_message:
Update the include to import_tasks for ansible

The use of 'include' for tasks has been deprecated[0].
Use 'import_tasks'[1] for static inclusions or 'include_tasks'
for dynamic inclusions. This feature will be removed
in a future release.

[0]: http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/include_module.html
[1]: http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/import_tasks_module.html

Change-Id: I127b4b539aa2ad1114f70348857fd5622b583c26

commit_message:
Use fernet for barbican crypto key

Sha password is not always valid for barbican cripto key.
Use a fernet key so it always gets valid.

Not need release note for upgrade, users with a working
barbican not regenerate passwords, only new passwords will
get new type.

Change-Id: Ic8c4ca63219295d697062cff9cbf30fadbe49bf3

commit_message:
Removing unused arguments user_id and project_id

user_id and project_id are derived from the auth context.
These arguments are passed into the request body but never used
by the API.
Initially these arguments were introduced for creating admin or
special volumes or to be used in nested tenant but it didn't happen.

Change-Id: I7102fff39ff3a687fb05d6b242f64ba3ce0a727d
Closes-Bug: #1641982

commit_message:
Switch to use stestr for unit test

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
So we should switch to stestr.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I14ae3879465e622f36fd7bba3f04cb6e0cb7500e

set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

commit_message:
Add tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic4a3b28cb670c71fb205640a9a9338bbcf9bc9bf

commit_message:
Boostrap CLI tests no longer call auth controller

Ensure the CLI tests no longer directly call the auth controller.
If it is desireable to call a controller method, make sure it is
done through the complete WSGI stack. This ensures no test changes
are needed when moving `/auth` to flask (test changes are isolated)

Change-Id: Id4f795d2e479115dc7762d9c6e2fe3ee817a7b84
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Implement "no-update" test for trusts

Trusts explicitly do not implement "patch" or "put". We now explicitly
test for a 405 (Method Not Allowed), as updates are outside of the
Keystone API, in an isolated test.

Change-Id: I9b84732506f85df7ad820e3d1f2a0e3408ed071b
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Modernise requirements

Conform to the PTI for docs builds, add lower-constraints jobs, and use
upper-constraints instead of synced global requirements constraints.

Change-Id: Iaf1b54b35d02dbb733c7782b178e4eb774c02ef6

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors with later versions of hacking

We are stuck on a very old version of hacking (0.8). In order to move
forward, we need to fix a bunch of things that flake8 will complain about.

commit_message:
Python3: Don't use cmp() function

The built-in cmp() function has been removed in Python 3, so don't try to
use it.

Change-Id: Ic62b7032ec6fd555974fc0d818327879d53a8ff2

messages:
[{'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-07-17 14:00:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-07-18 01:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-07-18 05:42:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As k.opasiak submitted several patches in the plugin(thanks for the work), I did some first investigation about tempest usages in Trove and this plugin, and also came up with this patch. However there are several issues about continuing to maintain this repo:
* most current API tests should already covered by the fakemode, trove-functional-mysql and trove-scenario-xxx tests;
* Newly submitted scenario and API tests will be in the same case.
* trove currently use python-proboscis, which is based on python-nose, both of these projects are not maintained any more, we discussed about this for adopting new testing framework, but because of limited developerd and resources, this topic was thought of low priority for now.
* tempest docs also suggest API tests should be moved closer to the project itself[1], so API tests seems better to remain in the trove repo.
* migrating the current trove integrate tests to tempest scenarios ones could be the best solution if it's possible, however it looks like impossible as we cannot reuse trove instances across different scenario tests, and creating new trove instance for every scenario test could be really inefficient.
* the biggest benefits for a tempest plugin may be, the user/deployer could use this plugin to verify their own deployments."}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-07-18 05:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Another problem I forgot to mention in the previous comment is:
altough I added a new zuul job for this plugin, more work should be done to run new API and scenario tests, include building guest images, upload them to glance, initialize trove datastores etc, like all the steps done by trovestack kickstart.'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-07-19 14:49:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Zhao Chao, I'm glad you raised the subject of integration tests for Trove. I believe that enabling Tempest plugin in the CI pipeline is the first step towards improving the testing procedure for this project.

We have repeatedly launched native Trove integration tests so we had the opportunity to gain some experience in this area. During the use of this solution, we identified a lot of flaws that made our work very difficult:

* The solution is custom: Only few people in the community are familiar with its implementation; it is very difficult for new team members to add test scenarios.

* Additional manual steps are required to be made before running tests: Preparing networks, projects and users with specific properties.

* No test isolation: An error in one test affects the execution of subsequent tests.

* No cleaning phase: Deleting resources created during the test run is a separate test step. If it is not executed, for example due to a sudden interruption or execution error, we are left with many artifacts (eg. VMs, security groups etc.) that must be removed manually.

* Although the instances from the previous test steps are reused, their number is still significant, and the reduction of resource consumption does not compensate for the problems that result from the lack of isolation.

* Defective and partially obsolete documentation of how to use and develop integration tests.

Our side goal over the last year was to rewrite existing integration tests into Tempest framework. As of today, we have the following scenarios:
* Basic instance provisioning
* Database and user management
* Configuration groups
* Database upgrade
* Backup and restore (full and incremental)
* Basic cluster management (create, grow, shrink, delete)
* Cluster upgrade
* Event notifications
* Security management

Moreover, we have developed the foundations for a framework for building Trove-related tests in Tempest. We considered aspects such as: configuration, adapters for individual datastore engines, connection to database instances, etc. We are ready to share our ideas and contribute all scenarios to the community.

These are the first two changes that we have added. Soon more will appear:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580763/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583252/"}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-07-30 01:41:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

 > Trove. I believe that enabling Tempest plugin in the CI pipeline is
 > the first step towards improving the testing procedure for this

 > manually.

 > consumption does not compensate for the problems that result from

 > Moreover, we have developed the foundations for a framework for

 > as: configuration, adapters for individual datastore engines,
 > connection to database instances, etc. We are ready to share our
 > ideas and contribute all scenarios to the community.
 > 
 > These are the first two changes that we have added. Soon more will
 > appear:
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580763/
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583252/

 > Zhao Chao, I'm glad you raised the subject of integration tests for
 > Trove. I believe that enabling Tempest plugin in the CI pipeline is
 > the first step towards improving the testing procedure for this
 > project.
 > 
 > We have repeatedly launched native Trove integration tests so we
 > had the opportunity to gain some experience in this area. During
 > the use of this solution, we identified a lot of flaws that made
 > our work very difficult:
 > 
 > * The solution is custom: Only few people in the community are

 > following scenarios:
 > * Basic instance provisioning

 > These are the first two changes that we have added. Soon more will
 > appear:
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580763/
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583252/

Bartosz, thanks a lot for you and your team could help on this topic, I think you team have done some great work on that. I agree with the part of trove-integration you mentioned, and also believe migrating to tempest plugin is the right direction.

However like what I said in my first comment and last weekly meeting, I'm still not very familiar with tempest and will learn more about it to help we could go much more further with the migration.

The current problem is we should first create some part in the trove repo, to make sure every test case inside this repo will be tested by the OpenStack CI.

So I decide merge this one first, and then https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580763/ could be merged when we're sure it's ready.

After that, we have to go back to trove part, creat new elements and playbooks, to prepare for the environment all the other test cases could run."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 14:00:38.000000000', 'message': "A new Zuul job for trove-tempest-plugin itself

Recently there are new patches in this plugin, it's necessary all new
tests will be tested, however the current
python-troveclient-tempest-neutron-src job in fact does not run any
tests of trove-templest-plugin(only the default tempest api and scenario
tests are included). This patch add a new job only for this plugin
itself, we may also could just remove the
python-troveclient-tempest-neutron-src job later.

Change-Id: I0ff8133c1235bde27d3a66786d65f99f16b9a1fa
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
A new Zuul job for trove-tempest-plugin itself

Recently there are new patches in this plugin, it's necessary all new
tests will be tested, however the current
python-troveclient-tempest-neutron-src job in fact does not run any
tests of trove-templest-plugin(only the default tempest api and scenario
tests are included). This patch add a new job only for this plugin
itself, we may also could just remove the
python-troveclient-tempest-neutron-src job later.

Change-Id: I0ff8133c1235bde27d3a66786d65f99f16b9a1fa
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

inside of _get_root_secret.

commit_message:
Define keymaster log routes on the class

... instead of having KmipKeyMaster instantiate its own logger
inside of _get_root_secret.

Bonus: KmsKeyMaster uses its own log route now.

Bonus bonus: get rid of KmsKeyMaster's pointlessly-overriden
__init__ method.

Change-Id: Idb4b832e5ca0e3d749fe2c0b7ba283447a4dc69e

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I74706b3551bf0a9a56deca090d744d3156a34aa8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 04:26:30.000000000', 'message': 'Use Tempest scenario job to run all scenario tests

Tempest has migrated the scenario job in Tempest
tree and renamed it to "tempest-scenario-all".[1]

This job runs all the Tempest scenario tests including
slow tests.

Old job running Tempest scenario test is running as experimental
in cinder[2]. That job will be removed in favor of "tempest-scenario-all"

This new job "tempest-scenario-all" will run as voting on check pipeline
where old job was running as experimental. This is fine as we want to run
all scenario tests on nova to avoid any regression.

Tempest also run "tempest-scenario-all" as voting job.

Detailed discussion on ML[3].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/.zuul.yaml#n147
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/zuul.d/projects.yaml#n3568
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130394.html

Change-Id: I984c9c449303effa5a3d8b754a3f4363add3dada
'}]
commit_message:
Use Tempest scenario job to run all scenario tests

Tempest has migrated the scenario job in Tempest
tree and renamed it to "tempest-scenario-all".[1]

This job runs all the Tempest scenario tests including
slow tests.

Old job running Tempest scenario test is running as experimental
in cinder[2]. That job will be removed in favor of "tempest-scenario-all"

This new job "tempest-scenario-all" will run as voting on check pipeline
where old job was running as experimental. This is fine as we want to run
all scenario tests on nova to avoid any regression.

Tempest also run "tempest-scenario-all" as voting job.

Detailed discussion on ML[3].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/.zuul.yaml#n147
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/zuul.d/projects.yaml#n3568
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130394.html

Change-Id: I984c9c449303effa5a3d8b754a3f4363add3dada

[{'account_id': 27733, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:23:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-06-20 07:28:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks and welcome to OpenStack contribution.'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-07-19 13:46:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-07-20 07:46:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-07-30 01:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks, :)'}]

Commit 3a90c7949ccd ("Apply cookiecutter to newly split project
trove-tempest-plugin") adds (among many other things) doc for this
repo. Unfortunately a "search and replace" phase failed and Zaqar word
has not been replaced with Trove in installation.rst.

commit_message:
doc: Fix copy-paste errors in install guide

Commit 3a90c7949ccd ("Apply cookiecutter to newly split project
trove-tempest-plugin") adds (among many other things) doc for this
repo. Unfortunately a "search and replace" phase failed and Zaqar word
has not been replaced with Trove in installation.rst.
This commit fixes this dummy mistake.

Change-Id: If37590f6b7d27b84623663c54452fd67ae26c74c
Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Opasiak <k.opasiak@samsung.com>

[{'created': '2018-07-25 20:38:22.000000000', 'message': "Enable mutable config in designate

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter.

This commit is to use the same. This allows designate to benefit from

(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config.

tc goal:

commit_message:
Enable mutable config in designate

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter.

This commit is to use the same. This allows designate to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config.

tc goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html

Change-Id: I5fba66b32b2b8eeea7c206e9eaec0d8c217dafb2

commit_message:
Add missing service for DockerCinderConfigImage

OS::TripleO::Services::BlockStorageCinderVolume has a mandatory
DockerCinderConfigImage parameter, but is missing an entry here, this
change adds that entry.

Change-Id: I20f04e8b821058a89a5464c9be1bb14d30f1f223
Closes-Bug: 1783653
(cherry picked from commit 60124eb653cfab2d3af1f69be7b365398b011c8d)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

Modify lower-constraints.txt so that it matches the settings in the
requirements files.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I7f8b14b5238cf92002d507104c8506e6a1c895dd
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Create Slides for Missing Contrib Guide Sections

Ideally, we should have a set of slides, with exercises
for each section of the contributor guide. This patch
gets the training-guides closer to that parity.

Three new sets of slides are being added- one for accounts,
one for configuring gerrit, and one for the patch guru section
of the contributor guide.

The exercises from the Commit Messages Slides are moved into the
setup and first patch slides since they cover information about
git and creating patches.

The patch also reorders a bit so that the development topics
are in the correct order for setting new contributors up to
start pushing patches.

Change-Id: I01d9a375728d9abe91b50c59b21ee120dc8ee518

[{'created': '2018-07-25 09:08:16.000000000', 'message': 'Delete error volume which auto_remove is True

Create a container and create a volume at the same time. If the volume is
error , it would not be deleted even if it is auto_removed. Because this
error occured in _wait_for_volumes_available, VolumeMapping object has
not created in sql at that time. But the _fail_container get the volumes
from the sql.
  We can delete these volumes before calling _fail_container in

commit_message:
Delete error volume which auto_remove is True

Create a container and create a volume at the same time. If the volume is
error , it would not be deleted even if it is auto_removed. Because this
error occured in _wait_for_volumes_available, VolumeMapping object has
not created in sql at that time. But the _fail_container get the volumes
from the sql.
  We can delete these volumes before calling _fail_container in
_wait_for_volumes_available().

Change-Id: I3cbf78bd57dcf56da09c94965679583fd63cdbd5
Closes-bug: #1783517

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 17:18:10.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0a9458e4a851dfd873db5b0d7d12c78c93299dff
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0a9458e4a851dfd873db5b0d7d12c78c93299dff

commit_message:
Split Governance and Releases Sections

This patch splits release content out from the governance
section so that its a little less daunting to new contributors. It
also then matches the way the exercises are split up in the training
guides.

Change-Id: I0494b29bb5bc4beaf1410b68aed6833309f1fbac

commit_message:
Fix to configure RABBIT_CAPABILITIES

This PS fixes the rabbitmq exporter configurations.

Now, RABBIT_CAPABILITIES env values can not be set because of dummy
values.

After fix values, it needs to upgrade exporter image version because
of string parsing problem in the exporter.

Additional, bert option is added.

https://github.com/kbudde/rabbitmq_exporter

Change-Id: Ida5fae0697c59023eb8a605a13f0279138929969

commit_message:
update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

It also updates the project zuul jobs to pull in openstack/neutron from
git for the lower constraints job (see failure in PS1).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

Change-Id: Ieed673b74d8fef81db57e9e4c26f85207b39e6d6

subject: Change Ordering
messages: [{'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-07-29 13:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-29 14:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-07-29 15:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nlgtm, thx'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-29 13:42:00.000000000', 'message': "Change Ordering

Before this patch, task tracking was after the git section which didn't
make sense because in a normal workflow you would figure out what bug
or new feature you are working on before fiddling with starting a new
patch.

This patch also moves IRC to be right after the communication section and
events to be further up in the more overview themed sections.

Change-Id: I6b12e1efbecabaf25ab7deee8f9fdccbf5198913
"}]
commit_message:
Change Ordering

Before this patch, task tracking was after the git section which didn't
make sense because in a normal workflow you would figure out what bug
or new feature you are working on before fiddling with starting a new
patch.

This patch also moves IRC to be right after the communication section and
events to be further up in the more overview themed sections.

Change-Id: I6b12e1efbecabaf25ab7deee8f9fdccbf5198913

commit_message:
Create port with port_vnic_type and port_profile from config

modify create_port function to use tempest.conf parameters,
'port_vnic_type' and 'port_profile' in case they are defined.

commit_message:
ceph-osd: Make hash calculcation deterministic

Go returns the keys of a map in arbitrary order, so the name of DaemonSets
which includes a hash over all matchExpressions could change when upgrading
releases eventhough the node or label selector hasn't changed.

Change-Id: I882c7b51d52ba4ace99b8a8830725ae38a1c3b94
Co-authored-by: Lars Fenneberg <lf@elemental.net>
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>
Story: 2002774

I'm trying to use this change in my real installation and I'm getting 404 error. See debug log from Octavia-worker (https://pastebin.com/ByXA8hzM) with operation "listener create" and see debug log from amphora-agent (https://pastebin.com/2rQVyjtC). In the log, I see that Octavia tried to get the certificate's checksum from amphora before load it. This place in code: https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/amphorae/drivers/haproxy/rest_api_driver.py#L195
and by the logic of the code in this place we must ignore code 404, but in exceptions handler (https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/amphorae/drivers/haproxy/exceptions.py#L37) we already printed error message.
I suggest using the `ignore` parameter of check_exception method in line https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/amphorae/drivers/haproxy/rest_api_driver.py#L352 for fix this situation.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-25 20:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

This is granted an FFE to August 1.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-26 02:01:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Rename ovs_port throughout the code

As the notation of ovs_port is not relevant any more, rename it
throughout the code to switch_port which is the new class.

Change-Id: I1eb1ff4d10265c7a64f38d158ddb6c7186eba06e

commit_message:
Rename ofport in switch_port to port_num

As we changed the port from ovs port to a generic port, the ofport
notation is not relevant any more.
We should use the port_num notation that is more generic.

Change-Id: I64574b47719aff8666341fa1cbd7a8fb3e390fc3
Partial-Bug: #1781376
