revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 06:02:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove deprecated config options usage

Tempest has deprecated the allow_tenant_isolation config option
of auth and compute groups since 3 years in I78a4884e980ef7d0103639cb3792a54c69fb7761.

Now Tempest patch - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582698/ is removing
this deprecated options.

This commit remove the usage of deprecated or already removed
tempest config options from tripleo.sh.

Change-Id: I122a52a04ae7186163a0f027edce3bce8f0d8116
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582698/
'}]
commit_message:
Remove deprecated config options usage

Tempest has deprecated the allow_tenant_isolation config option
of auth and compute groups since 3 years in I78a4884e980ef7d0103639cb3792a54c69fb7761.

Now Tempest patch - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582698/ is removing
this deprecated options.

This commit remove the usage of deprecated or already removed
tempest config options from tripleo.sh.

Change-Id: I122a52a04ae7186163a0f027edce3bce8f0d8116
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582698/

commit_message:
Logging: Only output std logs to stdout

This PS removes the double logging of openstack components that
were caused by outputting to both stdout and stderr.

Change-Id: I6e0ae5861bbf5b8d736ae08251aa865e1c4ce0d8
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

messages:
[{'account_id': 27478, 'date': '2018-07-28 03:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-07-28 03:59:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-28 06:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}]

commit_message:
Set bionic beaker as not voting

Until we figure out how we can resolve the issue
with supporting both ruby 2.0 from centos and the
later ruby 2.5 version shipped in bionic.

Change-Id: I2787b69f7587c55945c104cc66a1c614b738cd20

subject: Add Grafana dashboards for stable Neutron releases
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-06-26 20:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-06-26 20:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If anyone has a better idea for naming than "back one" and "back two" I am very open to it.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-06-26 21:05:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

My comments would also apply to the twoback file as well.

Regarding names, since we don't want to change them every time, some generic naming like you did is fine, but maybe put "stable" in the name?  neutron-stable-minusone ?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-27 09:45:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

IIRC we discussed on IRC some time ago to group tests from different releases on one chart, see: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-neutron/%23openstack-neutron.2018-06-20.log.html#t2018-06-20T15:12:34

Do You think that having separate dashboards for each branch is better?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-06-28 05:00:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-07-17 15:34:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

@slaweq when I looked at the sheer number of jobs that would be involved, it would have necessitated a complete restructuring of the dashboards.  After all, both queens and pike have openstack-tox-pep8, openstack-tox-py27, openstack-tox-py35, etc.  For example we have 7 jobs in the "Integrated Tempest Failure Rates (Gate queue)" panel in the main dashboard; expanding that to 14 jobs to show the same layout but with both queens and pike would just be too many datapoints.  And I think it would be useful to keep the same format so that someone can flip back and forth between the charts and differences in trends will be obvious, because equivalent data will be in the same spot.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-07-17 15:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-07-27 17:53:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-28 17:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-26 20:09:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add Grafana dashboards for stable Neutron releases

In the Neutron CI meeting [1] it was discussed that failures on CI jobs
for stable branches were not getting sufficient visibility, because
the lack of dashboarding means that we are dealing with anecdotal data
as opposed to trended metrics.  This change adds "back one" and "back
two" dashboards (referring to stable/queens and stable/pike
respectively) that can persistently refer to the last two stable
releases, and will be updated with each release to refer to the proper
stable branches.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2018/neutron_ci.2018-06-19-16.00.log.html#l-70

Change-Id: I8a372ffe640ef1125e6acc2d5e40ef54c9f8e261
'}, {'created': '2018-07-17 15:42:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add Grafana dashboards for stable Neutron releases

In the Neutron CI meeting [1] it was discussed that failures on CI jobs
for stable branches were not getting sufficient visibility, because
the lack of dashboarding means that we are dealing with anecdotal data
as opposed to trended metrics.  This change adds "back one" and "back
two" dashboards (referring to stable/queens and stable/pike
respectively) that can persistently refer to the last two stable
releases, and will be updated with each release to refer to the proper
stable branches.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2018/neutron_ci.2018-06-19-16.00.log.html#l-70

Change-Id: I8a372ffe640ef1125e6acc2d5e40ef54c9f8e261
'}]
commit_message:
Add Grafana dashboards for stable Neutron releases

In the Neutron CI meeting [1] it was discussed that failures on CI jobs
for stable branches were not getting sufficient visibility, because
the lack of dashboarding means that we are dealing with anecdotal data
as opposed to trended metrics.  This change adds "back one" and "back
two" dashboards (referring to stable/queens and stable/pike
respectively) that can persistently refer to the last two stable
releases, and will be updated with each release to refer to the proper
stable branches.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2018/neutron_ci.2018-06-19-16.00.log.html#l-70

Change-Id: I8a372ffe640ef1125e6acc2d5e40ef54c9f8e261

commit_message:
Add support for n-server to manage n-d-r package

When enabling 'bgp' in the service_plugins neutron-server
will try to start and load the bgp service plugin but if
the neutron-dynamic-routing package is not there it will
fail to start.

This adds a mechanism to enable installation of the n-d-r
packages by setting the enable_dr_package in neutron::server
same as done for VPNaaS, LBaaS etc.

Change-Id: I8a50f36ea3e824ebd959e627e0de90cd28ec4e56
(cherry picked from commit ef6d25c2fd47f1e925c073dd5681312f506b5759)

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583262/
Change-Id: I8a50f36ea3e824ebd959e627e0de90cd28ec4e56
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for n-server to manage n-d-r package

When enabling 'bgp' in the service_plugins neutron-server
will try to start and load the bgp service plugin but if
the neutron-dynamic-routing package is not there it will
fail to start.

This adds a mechanism to enable installation of the n-d-r
packages by setting the enable_dr_package in neutron::server
same as done for VPNaaS, LBaaS etc.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583262/
Change-Id: I8a50f36ea3e824ebd959e627e0de90cd28ec4e56

subject: Add support to customize polling meters
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 13:37:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add support to customize polling meters

This adds a new parameter called polling_meters
to the ceilometer::agent::polling class.

If you pass a array of strings this parameter
will then populate the meters in the polling.yaml
file by inserting them in the templated polling file.

The default values that was hardcoded in the template
is still the same but has been moved to the params class
as an array of strings.

Change-Id: Iae2567b5a0f24b2aa80f9640ff10df96cd656922
(cherry picked from commit f236f531df8f342c475973620e3f3913399dc2c0)
'}]
commit_message:
Add support to customize polling meters

This adds a new parameter called polling_meters
to the ceilometer::agent::polling class.

If you pass a array of strings this parameter
will then populate the meters in the polling.yaml
file by inserting them in the templated polling file.

The default values that was hardcoded in the template
is still the same but has been moved to the params class
as an array of strings.

Change-Id: Iae2567b5a0f24b2aa80f9640ff10df96cd656922
(cherry picked from commit f236f531df8f342c475973620e3f3913399dc2c0)

commit_message:
Take WSGIScriptAlias into account in docker healthcheck.

Some services running as vhost, as nova_placement make
use of an  alias in which the wsgi service is mapped.
Currently, the nova_placement healthcheck has hardcoded
the alias in the curl [0] request, but if this alias
changes or other service modifies its from / to another,
then the check will start failing again.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/healthcheck/nova-placement#L6

Change-Id: I5a325be424740e80eafd6b4abd8eb4b3111740aa
Closes-Bug: #1781623

[{'created': '2018-06-17 22:55:58.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Fix the json schema for network_attach

In before, the json schema didn't allow API calls for network_attach
with neither 'network' nor 'port' parameters. However, it is
a valid request to call network_attach without parameter. In this
case, Zun will choose a network for the container as how it is
done on container create.

This patch fixes the issue. With this patch, the network_attach API
(POST /containers/<container>/network_attach) will behave as following:
* Either 'network' or 'port' is provided -> ALLOW
* Neither 'network nor 'port' is provided -> ALLOW
* Both 'network' and 'port' is provided -> DISALLOW

Change-Id: I4933e14d850be10c16a1859cb8c4a8a09b75151d

commit_message:
Fix the json schema for network_attach

In before, the json schema didn't allow API calls for network_attach
with neither 'network' nor 'port' parameters. However, it is
a valid request to call network_attach without parameter. In this
case, Zun will choose a network for the container as how it is
done on container create.

This patch fixes the issue. With this patch, the network_attach API
(POST /containers/<container>/network_attach) will behave as following:
* Either 'network' or 'port' is provided -> ALLOW
* Neither 'network nor 'port' is provided -> ALLOW
* Both 'network' and 'port' is provided -> DISALLOW

Change-Id: I4933e14d850be10c16a1859cb8c4a8a09b75151d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 12:18:57.000000000', 'message': 'Make host_aggregate_map dictionary case-insensitive

As of now, if hostname is set as "compute0.example.com" (in lower case)
and user tries to add this host to host-aggregate but by-mistake types
"COMPUTE0.example.com" (in capital case), then instead of throwing
HostNotFound error, that host is successfully added to host-aggregate
as "COMPUTE0.example.com". And after that if instance creation request
with flavor matching metadata as host-aggregate metadata comes, this
host is not filtered by scheduler, since there is no host with hostname
COMPUTE0.example.com, as added in host-aggregate.

Fixed the issue by lowercasing all hostnames in host_aggregate_map
dictionary.

Change-Id: Iee4b9bbf412adfdc6fdc62ea3429fb960d6ac2a2
Closes-Bug: 1709260
'}, {'created': '2018-07-25 09:41:20.000000000', 'message': 'Make host_aggregate_map dictionary case-insensitive

As of now, if hostname is set as "compute0.example.com" (in lower case)
and user tries to add this host to host-aggregate but by-mistake types
"COMPUTE0.example.com" (in capital case), then instead of throwing
HostNotFound error, that host is successfully added to host-aggregate
as "COMPUTE0.example.com". And after that if instance creation request
with flavor matching metadata as host-aggregate metadata comes, this
host is not filtered by scheduler, since there is no host with hostname
COMPUTE0.example.com, as added in host-aggregate.

Fixed the issue by lowercasing all hostnames in host_aggregate_map
dictionary.

Change-Id: Iee4b9bbf412adfdc6fdc62ea3429fb960d6ac2a2

(cherry picked from commit 0dc0db932e3ad5ad911f2072015cb9854f6e4e23)

commit_message:
Make host_aggregate_map dictionary case-insensitive

As of now, if hostname is set as "compute0.example.com" (in lower case)
and user tries to add this host to host-aggregate but by-mistake types
"COMPUTE0.example.com" (in capital case), then instead of throwing
HostNotFound error, that host is successfully added to host-aggregate
as "COMPUTE0.example.com". And after that if instance creation request
with flavor matching metadata as host-aggregate metadata comes, this
host is not filtered by scheduler, since there is no host with hostname
COMPUTE0.example.com, as added in host-aggregate.

Fixed the issue by lowercasing all hostnames in host_aggregate_map
dictionary.

Change-Id: Iee4b9bbf412adfdc6fdc62ea3429fb960d6ac2a2
Closes-Bug: 1709260
(cherry picked from commit 0dc0db932e3ad5ad911f2072015cb9854f6e4e23)

subject: Move MQ vhost/user creation into role
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-17 21:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-17 21:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-28 14:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nDuplicate'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:03:20.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- cloudkitty_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- cloudkitty_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: Ic8e93b4abfc787ea3ed5d8edaf15be2e5cf84403
"}]
commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- cloudkitty_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- cloudkitty_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: Ic8e93b4abfc787ea3ed5d8edaf15be2e5cf84403

commit_message:
Omit ircnick from docs if empty

If a candidate doesn't have an IRC nic we currently display '(None)'
where other candidates get '(a_nic)'.  While I don't think that people
will genuinely confuse 'None' for an IRC nic lets just not include
anything in the output.

Change-Id: Ic41b89f11bf4473b226bc359529bf408c77ce998

commit_message:
Update render-statistics for new election style

* Fix candidate detection to look for files containing an '@' rather
  than ending in '.txt'
* Clarify the tool description
* Exit early if it's a TC election
* This election cycle used a slightly different label for the nomination
  phase :/ my bad

Change-Id: I8250952341850e0d58cc3910a20931060d670e88

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 03:18:34.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Use source vifs when unplugging on source during post live migrate

With the changes in blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api, we now
manage port bindings on both the source and destination host and
those can be different vif types to support live migrating between
different network backends, e.g. linuxbridge-ovs, ovs->ovn, etc.

The dest host port bindings are created during pre_live_migration
and then activated on the source host during post-copy (for the
libvirt driver) or in _post_live_migration when we call the
migrate_instance_start() method in the network API. When the dest
host port bindings are activated, the source host port bindings
are automatically deactivated (it's an atomic operation in neutron).

Depending on when we refresh the nw info cache on the instance,
we can end up calling driver.post_live_migration_at_source() with
information about the unbound source port binding, or the vif type
for the destination host port binding. Because of that, unplug_vifs
on the source can call since it's not using the proper vif type.

To resolve that, we use the stashed VIFMigrateData.source_vif
when unplugging vifs on the source host. Those source vifs are
an exact copy of the vifs on the instance before live migration
started on the source host, so they are appropriate for unplugging
on the source during _post_live_migrate.

Change-Id: Ie6439499cc7c6f05eec692dda677caf649dd7c94
Closes-Bug: #1783917
"}, {'created': '2018-07-27 03:56:57.000000000', 'message': "Use source vifs when unplugging on source during post live migrate

migrate_instance_start() method in the network API. When the dest
host port bindings are activated, the source host port bindings
are automatically deactivated (it's an atomic operation in neutron).

Depending on when we refresh the nw info cache on the instance,
we can end up calling driver.post_live_migration_at_source() with
information about the unbound source port binding, or the vif type
for the destination host port binding. Because of that, unplug_vifs
on the source can fail since it's not using the proper vif type.

To resolve that, we use the stashed VIFMigrateData.source_vif
when unplugging vifs on the source host. Those source vifs are
an exact copy of the vifs on the instance before live migration
started on the source host, so they are appropriate for unplugging
on the source during _post_live_migration.

Change-Id: Ie6439499cc7c6f05eec692dda677caf649dd7c94
Closes-Bug: #1783917
"}]
commit_message:
Use source vifs when unplugging on source during post live migrate

With the changes in blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api, we now
manage port bindings on both the source and destination host and
those can be different vif types to support live migrating between
different network backends, e.g. linuxbridge-ovs, ovs->ovn, etc.

The dest host port bindings are created during pre_live_migration
and then activated on the source host during post-copy (for the
libvirt driver) or in _post_live_migration when we call the
migrate_instance_start() method in the network API. When the dest
host port bindings are activated, the source host port bindings
are automatically deactivated (it's an atomic operation in neutron).

Depending on when we refresh the nw info cache on the instance,
we can end up calling driver.post_live_migration_at_source() with
information about the unbound source port binding, or the vif type
for the destination host port binding. Because of that, unplug_vifs
on the source can fail since it's not using the proper vif type.

To resolve that, we use the stashed VIFMigrateData.source_vif
when unplugging vifs on the source host. Those source vifs are
an exact copy of the vifs on the instance before live migration
started on the source host, so they are appropriate for unplugging
on the source during _post_live_migration.

Change-Id: Ie6439499cc7c6f05eec692dda677caf649dd7c94
Closes-Bug: #1783917

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 13:17:44.000000000', 'message': "Correct forwarding graph 'id' to match 'chain_id' in port chain

This patch lets forwarding graph 'id' to match 'chain_id' in
port chain. When users don't provide forwarding graph 'id',
that 'id' will be updated automatically by port chain creation
in networking-sfc.

commit_message:
Correct forwarding graph 'id' to match 'chain_id' in port chain

This patch lets forwarding graph 'id' to match 'chain_id' in
port chain. When users don't provide forwarding graph 'id',
that 'id' will be updated automatically by port chain creation
in networking-sfc.

Change-Id: I4e1dba75078593ba35f3995a26336ed538669579

commit_message:
Make index retention calculation pluggable

This allows alternate algorithms to be developed and enables the
same tasks to be included in a test to verify the planned retention
does not exceed the cluster storage capacity.

Change-Id: Ie3d80d6cfad16b946ccd790859bc7cd92b90fdef

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:09:38.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- swift_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- swift_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I3d5e00e090d37ea7aa95460965749ef066b63b23

commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement the new variable:
- swift_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

This is used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584630
Change-Id: I3d5e00e090d37ea7aa95460965749ef066b63b23

commit_message:
Add Monasca Agent container

The Monasca Agent consists of 3 processes. The collector, which
collects system level metrics from a host, a statsd server, which is used
to receive application specific statsd metrics and a forwarder service
which batches metrics and sends them to the Monasca API at pre-defined
time intervals.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers
Change-Id: Ia446ca0a6b932c2429d727b63e363b4e27307304

commit_message:
Set update_repo to gating_repo_name parameter

In previous releases we used gating_repo_name parameter
to set the repositories to be used to update container
packages. After moving it to tripleo-modify-image role,
repo name is hardcoded to gating-repo but in some cases
we need to use a different name (as in RDO rdoinfo jobs),
so making it configurable using the same parameter seems
to be a good option.

Change-Id: I1a7a9edde53ecc85bb347f3c7dc3140aac06985e

commit_message:
Verify docker API version if runtime is specified

The 'runtime' parameter is supported in Docker API version 1.26
or later. This patch add a validation on this requirement.

In addition, this patch allows Zun to work with legacy Docker
API version if 'runtime' parameter is not specified.
Right now, Kolla is using Docker API version 1.24 so it requires
this fix to make it work.

Change-Id: I04fb640977bfb6e0e5771806c9327b347fe8ed48
(cherry picked from commit c0ad682b005d9e0f27846329136dde3350cedf65)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 12:52:54.000000000', 'message': 'Clone Zun repository by TARGET_BRANCH

The variable $TARGET_BRANCH will be set by devstack. It will point
to the right branch that the devstack is based on. For example,
if the devstack is on a stable branch, TARGET_BRANCH will point to
that stable branch. Using this variable will save us the manual
effort to update the branch whenever we cut a release.

Change-Id: If71cd66e28ca44ec2af4c6a6daaa9db74b49186b
(cherry picked from commit b7bbf97bdc4b684d5ca3ce8c0e4a67c96a697168)
'}]
commit_message:
Clone Zun repository by TARGET_BRANCH

The variable $TARGET_BRANCH will be set by devstack. It will point
to the right branch that the devstack is based on. For example,
if the devstack is on a stable branch, TARGET_BRANCH will point to
that stable branch. Using this variable will save us the manual
effort to update the branch whenever we cut a release.

Change-Id: If71cd66e28ca44ec2af4c6a6daaa9db74b49186b
(cherry picked from commit b7bbf97bdc4b684d5ca3ce8c0e4a67c96a697168)

Thanks for submitting this Julia. I've only had a skim through so far, but it looks promising as an approach.

I think my main concern is that with this being implemented as a new driver, it wouldn't be possible to use the same node for ramdisk deploys and disk image deploys without admin intervention. I don't know the user requirements well enough to know whether that will be an issue in practice - we'll need to ask. Perhaps not - the types of machines that might want this tend to be fairly static in nature, and may even not have a disk to deploy to. Then again, one of the drivers for bringing in cloud technologies to HPC is flexibility, so..."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-17 14:40:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thanks for submitting this Julia. I've only had a skim through so
 > far, but it looks promising as an approach.
 > 
 > I think my main concern is that with this being implemented as a
 > new driver, it wouldn't be possible to use the same node for
 > ramdisk deploys and disk image deploys without admin intervention.
 > I don't know the user requirements well enough to know whether that
 > will be an issue in practice - we'll need to ask.

One of the interested people on the story mentioned without nova, which would imply they have baremetal admin. So I think something like this, in a dedicated sense makes sense for the fairly static deployments. We _should_ still wrap in cleaning and all of the other functionality, and it _should_ be easy to add to the direct deploy interface as well using the ramdisk boot_option.  So I guess, we have options, but regardless a dedicated interface might be good to keep around.


 >  Perhaps not - the
 > types of machines that might want this tend to be fairly static in
 > nature, and may even not have a disk to deploy to. Then again, one
 > of the drivers for bringing in cloud technologies to HPC is
 > flexibility, so..."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-23 16:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Feedback from sitting in the scientific SIG meeting: A number of attendees seemed positive that this was something that they desire, and it seems like a fairly easy win.... of course BFV boot scenario seems broken. :\'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-13 09:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Bikeshedding time \o/ I'd prefer we don't call it "pxe". What prevents us from having the same functionality with virtual media? Also I'm pretty sure people will confuse "pxe deploy", "pxe boot" and "pxe_ipmitool". Remember, we used to call the latter "pxe deploy" some time ago :(

Also I feel somewhat uneasy about using prepare_instance here. Why cannot we just use prepare_ramdisk? Is it because of networking, or..? Well, we anyway have to switch to provisioning network to boot the ramdisk, nobody guarantees that our PXE server is even available on tenant networks. Which poses an interesting problem around DHCP, hmm. Probably similar to rescue - we need to re-DHCP before handing the "deployed" ramdisk. A new IPA command?

I guess this wall of text means that I'd prefer to see a spec first..'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-06-14 00:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Bikeshedding time \o/ I'd prefer we don't call it "pxe". What
 > prevents us from having the same functionality with virtual media?
 > Also I'm pretty sure people will confuse "pxe deploy", "pxe boot"
 > and "pxe_ipmitool". Remember, we used to call the latter "pxe
 > deploy" some time ago :(

Virtual media would need to be tooled completely differently and would essentially need to be a static launcher from like an ISO. At least ramdisk we can iterate and support some additional scenarios and needs.  As for remembering when.... I don't remember last year ;)

 > 
 > Also I feel somewhat uneasy about using prepare_instance here. Why
 > cannot we just use prepare_ramdisk? Is it because of networking,
 > or..? Well, we anyway have to switch to provisioning network to
 > boot the ramdisk, nobody guarantees that our PXE server is even
 > available on tenant networks.

I wonder if this is going to be one of those drivers that we just document the case where it should work, the needs, and leave it at that. I'm not thinking something we ship as a default enabled feature.

 > Which poses an interesting problem
 > around DHCP, hmm. Probably similar to rescue - we need to re-DHCP
 > before handing the "deployed" ramdisk. A new IPA command?
 > 
I don't think that is something we can do nor would that even make sense to support....  The kernel has to be able to dhcp immediately, so we can't try and things to try and rely upon that. At least that is my feeling.

 > I guess this wall of text means that I'd prefer to see a spec
 > first..

Eh, we need more text! I can write a spec, but it is not going to say much. People have been asking for this functionality for a long time, it just seems reasonable and I think we have a very limited use case. We can describe that, but we absolutely can't spend six months to a year in specs-limbo.... especially given how minimal of a first step this could be.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-20 10:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

> > Bikeshedding time \o/ I'd prefer we don't call it "pxe". What
 > > prevents us from having the same functionality with virtual
 > media?
 > > Also I'm pretty sure people will confuse "pxe deploy", "pxe boot"
 > > and "pxe_ipmitool". Remember, we used to call the latter "pxe
 > > deploy" some time ago :(
 > 
 > Virtual media would need to be tooled completely differently and
 > would essentially need to be a static launcher from like an ISO. At
 > least ramdisk we can iterate and support some additional scenarios
 > and needs.  As for remembering when.... I don't remember last year
 > ;)

RamdiskDeploy?
StatelessDeploy?
DisklessDeploy?

Would any of these conflict with potential future use cases?

 > 
 > >
 > > Also I feel somewhat uneasy about using prepare_instance here.
 > Why
 > > cannot we just use prepare_ramdisk? Is it because of networking,
 > > or..? Well, we anyway have to switch to provisioning network to
 > > boot the ramdisk, nobody guarantees that our PXE server is even
 > > available on tenant networks.
 > 
 > I wonder if this is going to be one of those drivers that we just
 > document the case where it should work, the needs, and leave it at
 > that. I'm not thinking something we ship as a default enabled
 > feature.

I think we need to support booting on tenant networks, even if the details of how that is done are not yet clear. If we use the existing network interface logic, then a user can always choose the flat interface.

 > 
 > > Which poses an interesting problem
 > > around DHCP, hmm. Probably similar to rescue - we need to re-DHCP
 > > before handing the "deployed" ramdisk. A new IPA command?
 > >
 > I don't think that is something we can do nor would that even make
 > sense to support....  The kernel has to be able to dhcp
 > immediately, so we can't try and things to try and rely upon that.
 > At least that is my feeling.

Perhaps I misunderstood, but there is no IPA ramdisk involved in deployment with this driver? The user ramdisk is booted immediately. There was a request for a kexec-based driver, which would likely use IPA, but that is not what is implemented here AFAICT.

 > 
 > > I guess this wall of text means that I'd prefer to see a spec
 > > first..
 > 
 > Eh, we need more text! I can write a spec, but it is not going to
 > say much. People have been asking for this functionality for a long
 > time, it just seems reasonable and I think we have a very limited
 > use case. We can describe that, but we absolutely can't spend six
 > months to a year in specs-limbo.... especially given how minimal of
 > a first step this could be.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-06-26 01:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think kexec should be a feature that we can tag the driver as supporting.

This deploy driver would not use IPA for the actual deployment, but IPA would be used for cleaning still.'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-06-27 18:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

> Remember, we used to call the latter "pxedeploy" some time ago :(
 
I completely forgot about that... :(

 > Also I feel somewhat uneasy about using prepare_instance here. Why
 > cannot we just use prepare_ramdisk?

I leaned towards instance because we are configuring an instance, just the resulting template is a little different. We otherwise use prepare_ramdisk for ipa booting.

 > Is it because of networking,
 > or..? Well, we anyway have to switch to provisioning network to
 > boot the ramdisk, nobody guarantees that our PXE server is even
 > available on tenant networks.

We shouldn't expect to do that, given the fairly specific use cases, granted we could adapt some of the logic behavior in the underlying interface for RBD/NFS, but I think those would/should be driven via the storage interface given that we proposed those ideas for the storage interface.

 > I guess this wall of text means that I'd prefer to see a spec
 > first..

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-16 19:19:30.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] ramdisk deploy driver

Adds a pxe deploy driver to support the concept
of a deployment just consisting of a ramdisk.

Ideally, as long as a kernel and ramdisk are
defined, either by the operator or via a glance
image, the PXE/iPXE template should point the
booted kernel to using ramdisk as the root.

In theory, this would allow deployment via
nova, or directly using the parameters posted
to the node's instance_info.

There may be additional features realistically
needed for this to be beyond minimally useful,
but that would also depend on the contents of
the ramdisk that is deployed.

Change-Id: Id7067527cba27ed49753736f33ccb35e9b35bcba
Story: 1753842
Task: 10666

"}, {'created': '2018-07-11 18:31:42.000000000', 'message': "ramdisk deploy driver

Adds a pxe deploy driver to support the concept
of a deployment just consisting of a ramdisk.

Ideally, as long as a kernel and ramdisk are
defined, either by the operator or via a glance
image, the PXE/iPXE template should point the
booted kernel to using ramdisk as the root.

In theory, this would allow deployment via
nova, or directly using the parameters posted
to the node's instance_info.

There may be additional features realistically
needed for this to be beyond minimally useful,
but that would also depend on the contents of
the ramdisk that is deployed.

Change-Id: Id7067527cba27ed49753736f33ccb35e9b35bcba
Story: 1753842
Task: 10666

commit_message:
Adds ramdisk deploy driver

Adds a pxe deploy driver to support the concept
of a deployment just consisting of a ramdisk.

Ideally, as long as a kernel and ramdisk are
defined, either by the operator or via a glance
image, the PXE/iPXE template should point the
booted kernel to using ramdisk as the root.

In theory, this would allow deployment via
nova, or directly using the parameters posted
to the node's instance_info.

There may be additional features realistically
needed for this to be beyond minimally useful,
but that would also depend on the contents of
the ramdisk that is deployed by an API user.

Change-Id: Id7067527cba27ed49753736f33ccb35e9b35bcba
Story: 1753842
Task: 10666

commit_message:
zun: add property 'networks' to container

Add a new property 'networks' to resource OS::Zun::Container.
This property is an ordered list of nics to be added to this container,
with information about connected networks, fixed ips, port etc.
This property can be updated without replacement.

Story: 2003106
Task: 23222
Change-Id: I4b8c0257b83e97444dd8ff6ce88e240d12278ec2

commit_message:
Loosen docutils requirement pin

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573474 introduced a
problematic pinned requirement for docutils==0.11
which can't be supported across the various distros
that we need to support.

Change the requirement from strict equality to
greater-than-or-equal.

Change-Id: I92fcf6a516339a660395e5cd48e0a496158447e8

commit_message:
Update os_client_config to openstack.config

Since now os-client-config has been superceded by openstacksdk[1].
So need to replace the os-client-config in zaqarclient to
slove the issue that 'No module named os_client_config'.

[1]:https://docs.openstack.org/os-client-config/latest/

Change-Id: Icd133a467dea36f60d00f75a1113fcdf8e7ac76b

commit_message:
Rename unittest path openstack to openstack_resources

`openstack` is conflict with import path from openstacksdk, which lead to every
unittest under same level of `heat/tests/` must came out with complex way to
`import openstack` therefore change the path to `openstack_resources` is easier
way.

Change-Id: Ifb65f8e56222e9665e64d86b135271323bd23d0f

commit_message:
Support `cloud_provider` prop in remote stack

This property will allow remote stack to fetch authentication
information from clouds.ymal. See [1] for more information.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/latest/
configuration/index.html#clouds-yaml

Change-Id: I0393f07c0d2d915d01fda14451885fb958c6b307
Story: #2002126

commit_message:
Disallow actions when reference founded

Don't allow delete, abandon, or update Stack when Stack been
referenced by other Stack. Raise `ActionNotSupportedWithReference`
when referenced stack try to do above actions.
TODO: ADD tests

Change-Id: Iae1080b35f6b2cc246920ad6eaa1c54e93f2d452

subject: Add resource support for Stack Reference
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 08:40:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add resource support for Stack Reference

Allow create Stack Reference when resource use external resource
(with `external_id`) and that external resource was created by Heat
service. Delete that Stack Reference only when resource (which
defined with `external_id`) was deleted or abandoned.

TODO: Add tests

Change-Id: If284bfc23283c56b2e519a0af7089ca37cfbb389
'}]
commit_message:
Add resource support for Stack Reference

Allow create Stack Reference when resource use external resource
(with `external_id`) and that external resource was created by Heat
service. Delete that Stack Reference only when resource (which
defined with `external_id`) was deleted or abandoned.

TODO: Add tests

Change-Id: If284bfc23283c56b2e519a0af7089ca37cfbb389

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 16:26:01.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Revert non-reporting DISK_GB if sharing

Change Iea283322124cb35fc0bc6d25f35548621e8c8c2f went part way toward
implementing proper accounting for sharing providers, but the gaps it
left are untenable - see the associated bug report.

This removes the main functional piece of that change with TODOs to
reinstate it once the broader issues have been resolved.

Change-Id: I245a16315f97d0c2ca69c6ca9727a55a8ceb75ab
Related-Bug: #1784020
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Revert non-reporting DISK_GB if sharing

Change Iea283322124cb35fc0bc6d25f35548621e8c8c2f went part way toward
implementing proper accounting for sharing providers, but the gaps it
left are untenable - see the associated bug report.

This removes the main functional piece of that change with TODOs to
reinstate it once the broader issues have been resolved.

Change-Id: I245a16315f97d0c2ca69c6ca9727a55a8ceb75ab
Related-Bug: #1784020

commit_message:
update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

Change-Id: Ia1d0cc983d51963fe79bf2fcaaf934669a066340

commit_message:
Mount my.cnf.d into the db_sync container for Barbican and Octavia.

This ensures that the generated my.cnf.d configurations are present
in the Barbican and Octavia db_sync containers. Without these settings,
a MySQL authentication error stops the db sync when TLS is enabled for
MySQL.

Change-Id: I8aaabf013b50b963e9a973b2ccedcbd4f6a9197d
Closes-Bug: 1782392

(2 comments)

Thanks, but we can't accept these tests due to: https://docs.openstack.org/patrole/latest/REVIEWING.html#ensuring-code-is-executed

If this plugin is only enabled for NSX, then we can't add them upstream. If they are going to enable it for Contrail, then it makes sense to add these tests to our downstream version of Patrole but should carry over inline changes downstream."}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-20 14:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-20 14:41:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-20 14:43:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Thanks, but we can't accept these tests due to: https://docs.openstack.org/patrole/latest/REVIEWING.html#ensuring-code-is-executed
 > 
 > If this plugin is only enabled for NSX, then we can't add them
 > upstream. If they are going to enable it for Contrail, then it
 > makes sense to add these tests to our downstream version of Patrole
 > but should carry over inline changes downstream.

Alright. I will let it hang here for few days, and if nothing else appears - abandon it."}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-20 18:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Published edit on patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-28 03:12:34.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

(2 comments)Thanks, but we can't accept these tests due to: https://docs.openstack.org/patrole/latest/REVIEWING.html#ensuring-code-is-executedIf this plugin is only enabled for NSX, then we can't add them
upstream. If they are going to enable it for Contrail, then it
makes sense to add these tests to our downstream version of Patrole
but should carry over inline changes downstream."}]

commit_message:
update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

To work with neutron-lib 1.18.0, we need Rocky version of neutron,
so the minimum version of neutron is bumped to 13.0.0.0b2 (Rocky-2).

We also need to bump the minimum version of SQLAlchemy. Rocky neutron
depends on pending_to_persistent ORM event in SQLAlchemy which was added
in SQLAlchemy 1.1. Rocky neutron now requires SqlAlchemy>=1.2.0,
so the min version of SQLAlchemy is bumped to 1.2.0.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ifa33d7bc000ebbcf5e0f130fe0e0e34207f3361c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 18:34:28.000000000', 'message': "Add nova-status upgrade check for request spec migrations

We can't easily add a blocker db sync migration to make
sure the migrate_instances_add_request_spec online data
migration has been run since we have to iterate both cells
(for instances) and the API DB (for request specs) and that's
not something we should do during a db sync call.

But we want to eventually drop the online data migration and
the accompanying compat code found in the api and conductor
services.

This adds a nova-status upgrade check for missing request specs
and fails if any existing non-deleted instances are found which
don't have a matching request spec.

Related to blueprint request-spec-use-by-compute

Change-Id: I1fb63765f0b0e8f35d6a66dccf9d12cc20e9c661
"}]
commit_message:
Add nova-status upgrade check for request spec migrations

We can't easily add a blocker db sync migration to make
sure the migrate_instances_add_request_spec online data
migration has been run since we have to iterate both cells
(for instances) and the API DB (for request specs) and that's
not something we should do during a db sync call.

But we want to eventually drop the online data migration and
the accompanying compat code found in the api and conductor
services.

This adds a nova-status upgrade check for missing request specs
and fails if any existing non-deleted instances are found which
don't have a matching request spec.

Related to blueprint request-spec-use-by-compute

Change-Id: I1fb63765f0b0e8f35d6a66dccf9d12cc20e9c661

commit_message:
Recover python3 devstack jobs

During multinide jobs implementation, python3 job was lost.
This change recovers them into a initial state from multinode

Change-Id: I6ead3a7cdbb8bb25e6769713a2a5c9bafb1166b2

commit_message:
Cannot to delete vim, if barbican's secret does not existed.

When deleting vim, if the fernet key associated with vim does not
exist in barbican, vim is also allowed to be deleted.

Change-Id: Icec26074423fb0fcd04f0051706402c15da86d08
Closes-bug: #1783959

commit_message:
Ingress direction for min bandwidth rule

Make possible to have ingress direction for QoS  minimum_bandwidth_rule.
This will not automatically mean that the enforcement will work on the
dataplane for both directions.
The actual plan is to have only placement based enforcement for both
egress and ingress for all reference (sriov, ovs, linuxbridge)
implementations.

Change-Id: I4605376ea578ce8a20d83ed95f28d23f8fa82951
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 13:16:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix ironic containers data owning races

Complements I5ad4956174346f0$24945852da09f3841c3378c2b.
Fix ironic_pxe/inspector containers missing the kolla_config sections
to recursively chown /var/lib/ironic* shared paths. That removes data
owning races across other ironic containers starting on earlier or the
same steps/order.

For example, when ironic_pxe_http fails to access the
/var/lib/ironic/httpboot path shared with ironic_conductor, the latter
reports errors like:

DriverLoadError: Driver, hardware type or interface ilo-pxe could not
be loaded. Reason: [Errno 13] Permission denied:
'/var/lib/ironic/httpboot/...

Fixing the dir owner allows HW provisioning to complete w/o such
errors.

Change-Id: I34b54077c1c610a4bed73129e9784b2fa353e944
Closes-bug: #1783762
(cherry picked from commit 9d9daebdda3093e795b83075349b12d23f9241e8)
"}, {'created': '2018-07-26 13:23:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix ironic containers data owning races

"}]
commit_message:
Fix ironic containers data owning races

Complements I5ad4956174346f0$24945852da09f3841c3378c2b.
Fix ironic_pxe/inspector containers missing the kolla_config sections
to recursively chown /var/lib/ironic* shared paths. That removes data
owning races across other ironic containers starting on earlier or the
same steps/order.

For example, when ironic_pxe_http fails to access the
/var/lib/ironic/httpboot path shared with ironic_conductor, the latter
reports errors like:

DriverLoadError: Driver, hardware type or interface ilo-pxe could not
be loaded. Reason: [Errno 13] Permission denied:
'/var/lib/ironic/httpboot/...

Fixing the dir owner allows HW provisioning to complete w/o such
errors.

Change-Id: I34b54077c1c610a4bed73129e9784b2fa353e944
Closes-bug: #1783762
(cherry picked from commit 9d9daebdda3093e795b83075349b12d23f9241e8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 12:43:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix containerized ironic bind-mounts

We obvserve errors "DriverLoadError: Driver, hardware type or interface
ilo-pxe could not be loaded" as it uses the host level access to
/var/lib/ironic, which is owned by root.  When we have the
host/container(s) shared access to a bind mounted dir, it needs to be
shared instead of the default private mode.

Additionally, fix the missing /var/lib/ironic ownership change in
the ironix-pxe's kolla config.

Partial-bug: #1782267
Change-Id: I5ad4956174346f024945852da09f3841c3378c2b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 90a7a22f157b0f50d024d730e8b97ba268bc58ad)
'}, {'created': '2018-07-26 12:47:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix containerized ironic bind-mounts

We obvserve errors "DriverLoadError: Driver, hardware type or interface
ilo-pxe could not be loaded" as it uses the host level access to
/var/lib/ironic, which is owned by root.  When we have the
host/container(s) shared access to a bind mounted dir, it needs to be
shared instead of the default private mode.

Additionally, fix the missing /var/lib/ironic ownership change in
the ironix-pxe's kolla config.

Partial-bug: #1783762
Change-Id: I5ad4956174346f024945852da09f3841c3378c2b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 90a7a22f157b0f50d024d730e8b97ba268bc58ad)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix containerized ironic bind-mounts

We obvserve errors "DriverLoadError: Driver, hardware type or interface
ilo-pxe could not be loaded" as it uses the host level access to
/var/lib/ironic, which is owned by root.  When we have the
host/container(s) shared access to a bind mounted dir, it needs to be
shared instead of the default private mode.

Additionally, fix the missing /var/lib/ironic ownership change in
the ironix-pxe's kolla config.

Partial-bug: #1783762
Change-Id: I5ad4956174346f024945852da09f3841c3378c2b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 90a7a22f157b0f50d024d730e8b97ba268bc58ad)

commit_message:
[PIKE-only] remove experimental manila docker envs

Deployers have been ignoring the EXPERIMENTAL
comments at the top of these, deploying production
environments with them, and getting themselves
in trouble. Starting in stable/queens, deployment
of manila in docker containers rather than bare
metal is fully supported.

Change-Id: Ib03c0cc0a4084e9cd3a9e2cadad99fa8db6b792c

commit_message:
Fixes unlimited listener connection limit

When using the Octavia/amphora driver, unspecified or unlimited (-1)
settings would lead to a 2000 connection limit in HAproxy.
This patch updates that to be 1,000,000 connections.
1,000,000 was selected to amphora memory usage at a reasonable level.

Conflicts:
        octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/test_haproxy_compatibility.py
        octavia/tests/unit/common/jinja/haproxy/test_jinja_cfg.py
        octavia/tests/unit/common/sample_configs/sample_configs.py

Story: 1635416
Task: 5159

Change-Id: Iddeb62412bb71b69cf1e9198be6131c59a3051b0
(cherry picked from commit 294e0fc1288feabea7f412015e40b3609dfdb313)

commit_message:
Fix package version querying on non-dpkg distros

Non-Debian based amphora agents raise internal server error when
querying for a package version. That is due to the fact that the agent
currently assumes dpkg-based distros ignoring other OS families such as
Red Hat, SUSE, etc where the output from package info querying output is
slightly different from dpkg.

Story: 2002961
Task: 22963

Change-Id: Ied37bb0191ca8af4966d097f47ec80536dfc843f
(cherry picked from commit 2a7f1e5de2abbdae534996413855873d3e8a3792)

Thanks you!'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-07-12 00:55:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I tried to reproduce the issue (without this patch). I created an active-standby load balancer, and got 2 amphorae as expected. Then, I deleted both amphorae at same time. Load balancer provisioning_status kept on PENDING_UPDATE, even way over the 25 minutes connection retry window. I'd have expected it to go to ERROR as you've also mentioned in the commit message. I'll keep it going overnight. Maybe it will timeout at some point, or not.

Commands and logs: http://paste.openstack.org/show/725605/
HEAD: commit 26852b00de0127c5823ec060a24b4c0f5f62e4fb"}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-07-12 09:48:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

So I let it run. After ~1h15 minutes of trying to connect to the backup amphora (192.168.0.8), it eventually timed out and the outcome was of an unexpected LB and amphorae statuses, hence broke. This validates the bug, good. Again, this was pre-patching.

Firstly, note that it took 1h15 to time out which corresponds to 75 minutes so that is 1500 (connection_max_retries) * 3 (connection_retry_interval) but my connection_retry_interval in octavia.conf is set to 1! Is it configured to be connection_max_retries (1500) * 3 (of health_check_interval)? I'll need to check.

Then the worker tried to fail over to the BACKUP, which was not there anymore ("Nova instance with id: 0dd4ac65-e196-49e3-a252-f7902d8cf473 not found. Assuming already deleted.").

The result was a load balancer in ACTIVE operating_status with a new (!) and single amphora in BACKUP mode. See http://paste.openstack.org/show/725663/

Now, with the patch in, I tried to recover my existing load balancer. It did not recover. See http://paste.openstack.org/show/725665/

I then started from scratch with all Octavia resources purged. Somehow I now bumped into an issue I had not seen before. The haproxy package being installed on CentOS-based amphora images is named "haproxy18" [1], while the agent expects "haproxy" [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/26852b00de0127c5823ec060a24b4c0f5f62e4fb/elements/haproxy-octavia/pkg-map#L14
[2] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/26852b00de0127c5823ec060a24b4c0f5f62e4fb/octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/osutils.py#L310

Long story short: this patch works well for LB with listeners. If no listener is created, it will fail to fully recover resulting in a LB with a single amp.

For CentOS-based amps these two patches are required:
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582170/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582293/'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-07-20 17:56:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Agreed. The standing issue happens only on LBs without listeners associated to it which is per se not much of a real use case and people shouldn't bother much about it in case they have such empty/not useful LBs created."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-07-20 19:29:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-22 04:09:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix failover when multiple amphora have failed

If a load balancer loses more than one amphora at the same time
the failover process will fail and leave the load balancer in
provisioning status ERROR.

This patch resolves this by failing over one amphora at a time
marking any amphora that are also failed in status ERROR. The health
manager will then failover the other failed amphora in subsequent checks.

This patch will update multiple healthy amphora in parallel and will
timeout failed amphroa using the new "active_connection_max_retries"
configuration setting used for "fail-fast" connections.

The patch also updates the amphora failover flow documentation to
show the full flow and not just the spares failover flow.

It updates the amphora driver "get_diagnostics" method to pass instead
of error.

It also adds a AmphoraComputeConnectivityWait task to explicitly wait
for a compute instance to come up and be reachable. This allows a longer
timeout and clarifies this may fail due to compute (nova) failures.
Previously the first plug vip task would do this wait.

Change-Id: Ief97ddda8261b5bbc54c6824f90ae9c7a2d81701
Story: 2001481
Task: 6202

commit_message:
Fix failover when multiple amphora have failed

If a load balancer loses more than one amphora at the same time
the failover process will fail and leave the load balancer in
provisioning status ERROR.

This patch resolves this by failing over one amphora at a time
marking any amphora that are also failed in status ERROR. The health
manager will then failover the other failed amphora in subsequent checks.

This patch will update multiple healthy amphora in parallel and will
timeout failed amphroa using the new "active_connection_max_retries"
configuration setting used for "fail-fast" connections.

The patch also updates the amphora failover flow documentation to
show the full flow and not just the spares failover flow.

It updates the amphora driver "get_diagnostics" method to pass instead
of error.

It also adds a AmphoraComputeConnectivityWait task to explicitly wait
for a compute instance to come up and be reachable. This allows a longer
timeout and clarifies this may fail due to compute (nova) failures.
Previously the first plug vip task would do this wait.

Change-Id: Ief97ddda8261b5bbc54c6824f90ae9c7a2d81701
Story: 2001481
Task: 6202

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 08:18:18.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Support for microversions in base Resource and baremetal resources

This change allows a Resource to negotiate the highest microversion
supported by both the client (openstacksdk) and the server. It is
done by overriding Class._max_microversion to a non-None value.

The baremetal resources are updated with a _max_microversion reflecting
the currently supported set of fields. Note that it will make create()
call create nodes in the "enroll" state, which is a breaking change.

Change-Id: I78703bece7c1a3898e4a5b60cd7c2912cf4b5595

commit_message:
Support for microversions in base Resource

This change allows a Resource to negotiate the highest microversion
supported by both the client (openstacksdk) and the server. It is
done by overriding Class._max_microversion to a non-None value.

The microversion used to load or update a Resource is stored on it
as the "microversion" attribute.

Change-Id: I78703bece7c1a3898e4a5b60cd7c2912cf4b5595

excercises are being removed. see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581377/

commit_message:
Enhancements to CIDR and IP address constraints.

Currently the constraints do not reject an ipaddress for ipv4 which have
fewer than 3 dots such as 'a' or 'a.b' or 'a.b.c'.
This enhancement provides an extra check that an ipv4 address has syntax:
'a.b.c.d'

This also applies to CIDR

Change-Id: Ia7ec8bf107abd169b6b6a91d0b8bb913fc3cc7b9
Story: 2002552
Task: 22114

commit_message:
Add list backups with details for backup:backup_project_attribute

This patchset adds an RBAC test for validating that
"backup:backup_project_attribute" is included in response body
for listing backups with details following successful policy
authorization. The policy in code documentation indicates that
this API enforces this policy [0] and the policy is enforced in
the code here [1]. The expected attribute comes from [2].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/8f7bc140052091d141e2cf436e989aa2d15dd6f4/cinder/api/v3/backups.py#L89
[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/8f7bc140052091d141e2cf436e989aa2d15dd6f4/cinder/policies/backups.py#L57
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/8f7bc140052091d141e2cf436e989aa2d15dd6f4/cinder/api/v3/backups.py#L64

Change-Id: I8285b25b97de90e1911adf5e97ffd051d10adf90

[{'created': '2018-07-25 23:07:16.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing service for DockerCinderConfigImage

OS::TripleO::Services::BlockStorageCinderVolume has a mandatory
DockerCinderConfigImage parameter, but is missing an entry here, this
change adds that entry.

Change-Id: I20f04e8b821058a89a5464c9be1bb14d30f1f223
Closes-Bug: 1783653
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing service for DockerCinderConfigImage

OS::TripleO::Services::BlockStorageCinderVolume has a mandatory
DockerCinderConfigImage parameter, but is missing an entry here, this
change adds that entry.

Change-Id: I20f04e8b821058a89a5464c9be1bb14d30f1f223
Closes-Bug: 1783653

[{'created': '2017-09-06 20:12:38.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure instance mapping is updated in case of quota recheck fails

If an instance fails to successfully pass the quota recheck, it will
raise a TooManyInstances exception, however, it will not hit the
code which saves the instance mapping, leaving an instance with no
assigned cell in the mapping table.

This patch adds a test to make sure that an instance has the correct
cell mapping if it fails in the quota recheck phase.

The instance mapping code was moved to use the existing
_populate_instance_mapping function which seems to be more robust
in handling any possible edge cases when saving the instance mapping.

The schedule_and_build_instances codebase has a host mapping cache
which minimizes the number of queries made to the database, therefore,
the _populate_instance_mapping function was updated to be able to
accept a host_mapping so that it does not issue an extra database
query.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1715462

commit_message:
Ensure instance mapping is updated in case of quota recheck fails

If an instance fails to successfully pass the quota recheck, it will
raise a TooManyInstances exception, however, it will not hit the
code which saves the instance mapping, leaving an instance with no
assigned cell in the mapping table and no BuildRequest as it is
removed by _cleanup_build_artifacts.

This patch adds a test to make sure that an instance has the correct
cell mapping if it fails in the quota recheck phase.  In addition, it
uses the cell_mapping_cache dictionary to set the correct cell
mapping before marking the instance as ERROR.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1715462

Change-Id: I7ecb5feb47a5f358cd51bde87b75a3a6141b5b12

commit_message:
Optimized Ansible tasks in deplay-steps-tasks.yaml

- do not use set_fact when a lookup can be done directly in the task
- use multi-line YAML for easier legibility
- ignore errors in file lookup plugin when file does not exist and set defaults

Change-Id: I832a2ec34f4ed4a87e30d0c88f4c60bcf2f4c151
(cherry picked from commit 1deab1217dfe9727ac639fffa3e9baebf4d58205)

Looks good to me if fine to do so in in tempest too.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-24 01:06:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm not convinced we should make this change. A lot of the failures are due to -- test_create_server_with_scheduler_hint_group_anti_affinity -- which is Nova bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1781710. 

Right now I'm having trouble pulling up more info on openstack health but I would like to see the difference between tempest-multinode-full and tempest-full pass/failure ratio which would have to be pretty big before I think this should be downgraded to non-voting."}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-07-27 21:44:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Make 'tempest-multinode-full' non-voting

This job failed very often, and it was marked as non-voting in nova
and neutron already.

Change-Id: Ib06fab7141615e2f506d7ad9cec1a6681b1552a9

commit_message:
Add rbac_policies_client to network library

This commit adds the rbac_policies_client to the network library.
This commit also adds unit tests, API tests (including negative
tests), and reno for the new client.

In case the documentation cannot be found for this API, see:
I036a8108071b4b1db32c96ebb1b48da453e268b1

Implements blueprint: neutron-rbac-policies-api-tests

Change-Id: I93c0d5207a4bcaa6c68c60b280c4750066500a00

commit_message:
use callback payloads for ROUTER/ROUTER_GATEWAY BEFORE_DELETE events

This patch switches ROUTER/ROUTER_GATEWAY BEFORE_DELETE events to use
payload style args. It also factors _gateway_device_callback into a
separate callback specifically for ROUTER BEFORE_DELETE events to
support both styles; the TODO in the code can be cleaned up later.

Change-Id: Ia99885e859578a907cea1e16ca3934e5890b6c2b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562762
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578430/

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 20:03:03.000000000', 'message': "Update create_object to handled chunked data

If you pass an iterator that doens't have a len to create_object,
it fails trying to find the size. Size is needed for large object
support. If the calculation fails, just upload it directly.

Change-Id: I841d7049ff2f05e00a31fecbc27dda6a0007be16
"}, {'created': '2018-07-24 20:07:58.000000000', 'message': "Update create_object to handled chunked data

We try to calculate len for data, which breaks with chunked uploads, but
we only use that with filename. Move the code so that we don't try to
calculate length of things where we don't need to.

We still need to figure out streaming uploads and large objects.

Change-Id: I841d7049ff2f05e00a31fecbc27dda6a0007be16
"}, {'created': '2018-07-26 12:00:01.000000000', 'message': "Update create_object to handled chunked data

We try to calculate len for data, which breaks with chunked uploads, but
we only use that with filename. Move the code so that we don't try to
calculate length of things where we don't need to.

We still need to figure out streaming uploads and large objects.

This changes several unit tests due to the re-ordering of when
get_object_segment_size gets called. It's not necessary to call it for
the data path, so it was moved to later, which puts it after the
container create. For data paths this results in one less call. For file
paths, the calls are the same but the /info call happens later.

Change-Id: I841d7049ff2f05e00a31fecbc27dda6a0007be16
"}, {'created': '2018-07-26 20:02:54.000000000', 'message': "Update create_object to handled chunked data

We try to calculate len for data, which breaks with chunked uploads, but
we only use that with filename. Move the code so that we don't try to

We still need to figure out streaming uploads and large objects.

This changes several unit tests due to the re-ordering of when
get_object_segment_size gets called. It's not necessary to call it for
the data path, so it was moved to later, which puts it after the
container create. For data paths this results in one less call. For file
paths, the calls are the same but the /info call happens later.

Change-Id: I841d7049ff2f05e00a31fecbc27dda6a0007be16
"}, {'created': '2018-07-27 15:57:41.000000000', 'message': "Update create_object to handled chunked data

We try to calculate len for data, which breaks with chunked uploads, but
we only use that with filename. Move the code so that we don't try to
calculate length of things where we don't need to.

We still need to figure out streaming uploads and large objects.

This changes several unit tests due to the re-ordering of when
get_object_segment_size gets called. It's not necessary to call it for
the data path, so it was moved to later, which puts it after the
container create. For data paths this results in one less call. For file
paths, the calls are the same but the /info call happens later.

Change-Id: I841d7049ff2f05e00a31fecbc27dda6a0007be16
"}]
commit_message:
Update create_object to handled chunked data

We try to calculate len for data, which breaks with chunked uploads, but
we only use that with filename. Move the code so that we don't try to
calculate length of things where we don't need to.

We still need to figure out streaming uploads and large objects.

This changes several unit tests due to the re-ordering of when
get_object_segment_size gets called. It's not necessary to call it for
the data path, so it was moved to later, which puts it after the
container create. For data paths this results in one less call. For file
paths, the calls are the same but the /info call happens later.

Change-Id: I841d7049ff2f05e00a31fecbc27dda6a0007be16

Ideally we would prepare a patch for openstack/requirements to update the exclusions for everything that is different, but if the minimum specified in the global list is higher than the values excluded here that patch may not make much sense."}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-04-10 02:30:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-04-10 03:23:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Iac4a202a1d723822d10f4d34a397eff9de3f2108
add the job in project-config:
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
remove branch optimiazation in check and add swift exclusions (series):
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/560109
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>

commit_message:
zun: use containers.update for renaming

The old way of renaming is duplicated [1]. This patch uses the
new way to rename a container. In addition, this patch also
bump the version of python-zunclient to 2.0.0

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557595/

Change-Id: I4ef36a3c4a805b3e041fcb9456c297e59865485c

subject: Z3 engine as an alternative Datalog engine
messages:
[{'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-13 15:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-16 16:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-17 14:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-17 14:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

There is a major change in datalog.nonrecursive. I have made a mixin from all the methods handling rules in NonRecursiveTheory. This mixin is also used for Z3Theory but we do not inherit from the TopDown engine.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-18 05:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks Pierre. Makes sense!'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:33:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-20 13:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-20 16:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-23 16:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-25 16:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-25 18:04:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

This version solves the main bugs and has more unit tests. the only missing part is tests for top_down_eval but its contract is too weird. there are some types but i have ensured that they have no impact at runtime'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-26 09:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-26 16:17:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-26 16:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

To use z3 in devstack add to local.conf:
ENABLE_CONGRESS_Z3=True

This last update adds support for using precompiled Z3. Just add to
local.conf: 
USE_Z3_RELEASE=4.7.1

I have not modified the gate jobs to first enable Z3 and then use 
the precompiled release'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-26 18:27:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM. I have some minor comments which can be addressed in subsequent non-featureful patch if needed, but we can merge now for rocky-3.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-27 02:23:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)

Pretty incredible getting all this in by feature freeze! And great unit testing too. Just a couple suggestions:
Since this feature is considered preliminary/experimental at this point, we could add something like an 'experimental_z3_theory' option flag to make sure z3 theories can't be created unless the option is explicitly enabled.
https://github.com/openstack/congress/blob/master/congress/common/config.py#L73

The other thing you already mentioned in comments is tempest testing.

Thanks again Pierre!"}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-07-27 07:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

I am not sure we need a flag. z3types check if z3 is available and z3types.Z3_AVAILABLE is our flag. This is already used by agnostic to refuse to add a z3 theory. We can also short circuit if z3 is not there for the cycle tests. If the user has deployed z3 on his host, we can consider this is not by chance ! I will change the method name in the same patch. I have a tempest test ready that I will soon push. I will enable z3 on the gate in a separate patch that can be reverted at will if anything goes wrong.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-27 18:25:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

That's great about tempest and and gate!

I see what you mean about Z3_AVAILABLE. In theory, my preference is still to have an explicit config option because we don't want the behavior to change if the deployer installs Z3 on the same host for another use. In practice, it's very unlikely to be a problem. So I think it's fine either way."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 15:34:20.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Z3 engine as an alternative Datalog engine

Basic structure for the integration of Z3 into Congress.
Defines a Z3Theory as an alternative to nonrecursive theories.
Defines a Z3Context for executing Z3Theory content.

Limitations:

* Cannot retrieve data from other theories
* No typechecker.
* Cannot be called from a nonrecursive theory
* Does not support recursion (because there is a check at
  the level of agnostic that should be disabled for
  Z3Theory.

Partially-implements: blueprint alternative-engine-z3
Change-Id: I87ff439a3ed4a3e83c78c98add7d94275f716a01
'}, {'created': '2018-07-16 16:51:56.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Z3 engine as an alternative Datalog engine

Defines a Z3Theory as an alternative to nonrecursive theories.
Defines a Z3Context for executing Z3Theory content.
Z3 must be installed manually and is not in the requirements (the only supported pypi version z3solver has issues).

Limitations:

* No typechecker.
* Cannot be called from a nonrecursive theory
* Does not support recursion (because there is a check at
  the level of agnostic that should be disabled for
  Z3Theory.
* No reset (push/pop of Z3 contexts does not work).

Partially-implements: blueprint alternative-engine-z3
Change-Id: I87ff439a3ed4a3e83c78c98add7d94275f716a01

commit_message:
Z3 engine as an alternative Datalog engine

Basic structure for the integration of Z3 into Congress.
Defines a Z3Theory as an alternative to nonrecursive theories.
Defines a Z3Context for executing Z3Theory content.

Z3 must be installed manually and is not in the requirements
devstack will install Z3 if ENABLE_CONGRESS_Z3 is set.

Limitations:

* No built-ins
* Typechecking does not support sub-typing (will be done later through built-ins).

Partially-implements: blueprint alternative-engine-z3
Change-Id: I87ff439a3ed4a3e83c78c98add7d94275f716a01

commit_message:
Change neutron CI dashboard to a week view

The Neutron CI team, the primary customer for the Neutron Failure Rate
dashboard [1] meets once a week to review CI status.  It would be useful
if we did not need to change the Grafana view to a one-week view each
time, so a "time" stanza is added in accordance with the grafyaml
documentation [2].

[1] http://grafana.openstack.org/dashboard/db/neutron-failure-rate
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/grafyaml/

Change-Id: I20853dc71cbcc280e7039a1404d17c81ec172c5a
