subject: Run propose-updates for requirements-constraints to Python3.6
messages: [{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-24 23:03:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-25 06:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-07-27 17:20:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 23:03:34.000000000', 'message': "Run propose-updates for requirements-constraints to Python3.6

Currently we're running propose-updates forrequirements-constraints
under python 3.5 (on xenial).  We take the results of freezing the
constraints fro 3.5 and emit them as 3.4 constraints also.  In the near
term[1] we'd like to use the same technique to generate 3.6 constraints.

With the inclusion of I8784509bc162eb6f2e80261bc2d81dbe63ce7989, and
knowing that we no longer run on trusty node, we can now clone the 3.5
constraints freeze to both 3.4 and 3.6.  However given that soon we'll
be moving from xenial to bionic this introduces debt that will need to
be fixed after the August release.

Instead just move propose-updates for requirements-constraints job to
bionic now and start cloning 3.6 to 3.5 and 3.4.

Several jobs use propose-updates as a parent so I've made this change
specifically where we call the propose-updates job specifically for
requirements-constraints

Note: This may feel very familiar if you reviewed
I541b64afaee3bf466ff1a461fd2cb472657c4986, The aim is the same but I
mis-understood what propose-update-constraints was doing and it wasn't
the right job and was reverted in I75280b23e2e60800af45dc2343c82008ec9971a9

[1] See re-design discussion:
    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132152.html

Change-Id: I1874d4f20a6d69a881f0d9407e159c35ab21542d
"}]
commit_message:
Run propose-updates for requirements-constraints to Python3.6

Currently we're running propose-updates forrequirements-constraints
under python 3.5 (on xenial).  We take the results of freezing the
constraints fro 3.5 and emit them as 3.4 constraints also.  In the near
term[1] we'd like to use the same technique to generate 3.6 constraints.

With the inclusion of I8784509bc162eb6f2e80261bc2d81dbe63ce7989, and
knowing that we no longer run on trusty node, we can now clone the 3.5
constraints freeze to both 3.4 and 3.6.  However given that soon we'll
be moving from xenial to bionic this introduces debt that will need to
be fixed after the August release.

Instead just move propose-updates for requirements-constraints job to
bionic now and start cloning 3.6 to 3.5 and 3.4.

Several jobs use propose-updates as a parent so I've made this change
specifically where we call the propose-updates job specifically for
requirements-constraints

Note: This may feel very familiar if you reviewed
I541b64afaee3bf466ff1a461fd2cb472657c4986, The aim is the same but I
mis-understood what propose-update-constraints was doing and it wasn't
the right job and was reverted in I75280b23e2e60800af45dc2343c82008ec9971a9

[1] See re-design discussion:
    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132152.html

Change-Id: I1874d4f20a6d69a881f0d9407e159c35ab21542d

subject: Update create_object to handled chunked data
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-27 16:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2018-07-27 16:03:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-07-27 16:04:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-07-27 16:04:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2018-07-27 16:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 16:00:14.000000000', 'message': "Update create_object to handled chunked data

We try to calculate len for data, which breaks with chunked uploads, but
we only use that with filename. Move the code so that we don't try to
calculate length of things where we don't need to.

We still need to figure out streaming uploads and large objects.

This changes several unit tests due to the re-ordering of when
get_object_segment_size gets called. It's not necessary to call it for
the data path, so it was moved to later, which puts it after the
container create. For data paths this results in one less call. For file
paths, the calls are the same but the /info call happens later.

Change-Id: I841d7049ff2f05e00a31fecbc27dda6a0007be16
"}]
commit_message:
Update create_object to handled chunked data

We try to calculate len for data, which breaks with chunked uploads, but
we only use that with filename. Move the code so that we don't try to
calculate length of things where we don't need to.

We still need to figure out streaming uploads and large objects.

This changes several unit tests due to the re-ordering of when
get_object_segment_size gets called. It's not necessary to call it for
the data path, so it was moved to later, which puts it after the
container create. For data paths this results in one less call. For file
paths, the calls are the same but the /info call happens later.

Change-Id: I841d7049ff2f05e00a31fecbc27dda6a0007be16

commit_message:
Add linters check to make sure site-variables is yaml

A YAML syntax error in site-variables was merged recently. Errors in
that file break basically everything, so add a check that the file at
least parses.

Change-Id: I9b2c47a0461275e1d53aabe387f0309719d46b77

commit_message:
Fix getting secret for vault plugin

The following related tests in 'barbican-vault-devstack-functional' jenkins
job should pass with this patch:

test_secret_get_nones_payload_with_a_octet_stream
test_secret_create_defaults_valid_types_and_encoding
test_secret_create_with_secret_type

This patch also enables kv version 1 in Vault, otherwise the Vault API
interaction in castellan will fail.

Change-Id: Id3b2503b2adb4f1f5eff55bb22f41d904232c284
Story: 2002976
Task: 22984

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 21:17:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes a bug with issubclass() being called on an instance

Python 3.7.0 introduces a rewrite of ABC in C. issubclass() now seems to
enforce the class to be a class, not an instance.

Change-Id: I427b43596e1fd0162dba4283f2f31c3ba9f217dd
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes a bug with issubclass() being called on an instance

Python 3.7.0 introduces a rewrite of ABC in C. issubclass() now seems to
enforce the class to be a class, not an instance.

Change-Id: I427b43596e1fd0162dba4283f2f31c3ba9f217dd

messages: [{'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-07-27 15:14:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-07-27 15:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-07-27 15:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 15:14:55.000000000', 'message': 'Disable packethost in nodepool

For some reason, we keep losing the regional mirror in packethost,
which makes jobs fail.  Disable nodepool there until we better
understand what is happening.

Change-Id: I8d2a01cd1e1fa7421d72ba4b2f75d10d0511e7a7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Disable packethost in nodepool

For some reason, we keep losing the regional mirror in packethost,
which makes jobs fail.  Disable nodepool there until we better
understand what is happening.

Change-Id: I8d2a01cd1e1fa7421d72ba4b2f75d10d0511e7a7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-12 19:01:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-12 19:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-12 19:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-12 23:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Thanks. We will also need a relasenote for this change as it adds a new client to tempest/lib.

See: https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/REVIEWING.html#release-notes

Also, do you plan on adding any Tempest API tests for the new APIs you are adding here or will they be included in a Tempest plugin somewhere?'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-12 23:59:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Thanks. We will also need a relasenote for this change as it adds a
 > new client to tempest/lib.
 > 
 > See: https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/REVIEWING.html#release-notes
 > 
 > Also, do you plan on adding any Tempest API tests for the new APIs
 > you are adding here or will they be included in a Tempest plugin
 > somewhere?

Oh, sorry, I see some associated tests here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582388/

I'm OK with not adding API tests, but I think it should be relatively straightforward to include 1 test that covers CRUD API testing, provided that these APIs aren't testing already by the neutron-tempest-plugin (I haven't checked)."}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-07-13 00:20:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- neutron-tempest-dvr: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1686542

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-13 15:54:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-13 16:34:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-13 16:39:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

Thank you @Felipe. All requested changes are committed.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-13 18:36:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-07-13 21:20:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- neutron-tempest-dvr: unrecognized error
- nova-cells-v1: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-pep8: unrecognized error
- tempest-full-py3: unrecognized error
- tempest-full-queens-py3: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1758054
- tempest-full-queens: unrecognized error
- tempest-full: unrecognized error
- tempest-multinode-full: unrecognized error

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-13 23:38:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

As far as I can tell, Neutron builds out some of its APIs dynamically here: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/tree/neutron_tempest_plugin/services/network/json/network_client.py

Which includes segments APIs: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/tree/neutron_tempest_plugin/api/test_timestamp.py

Not sure if we should add the Segments API to Neutron given this, but it looks like Neutron already has an issue with Tempest test duplication on their end they're trying to figure out: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1552960

But the reason for this failure I believe is that the segment plugin isn't installed: https://github.com/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/blob/44bfb15830183d829e046f5088e87969ced4f9a9/.zuul.yaml#L28"}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-16 16:41:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Oh, you're right. I'll abandon this patchset than since it's only purposed to provide segments client."}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-16 21:09:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Oh, you're right. I'll abandon this patchset than since it's only
 > purposed to provide segments client.

I'm not sure if we should yet. I will have to talk to QA community about what the path forward here is.

Should Tempest host service clients for core services (I believe so) or should some service clients exist in Tempest and others in tempest plugins? This is the question that should be resolved."}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-23 19:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-27 16:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We will use neutron-tempest-plugin instead http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132422.html'}]

commit_message:
Update the default roles spec to include Rocky details

Since we're not going to get everything details in this specification
done in Rocky, we should update the spec to clarify why we did get
done and what we plan to pick in subsequent releases.

Change-Id: Ife2089167354b9e1c918dd9219aff5e5ff66e856

commit_message:
Use provided device paths

Ensure that device paths provided by end users are used for OSD's,
rather than the link target device as this may change between
reboots. The specific use case is bcache, where:

   /dev/bcacheX:
        changes between reboots
   /dev/disk/by-dname/bcacheX:
        udev managed and consistent

This change also ensures that any unit data is updated to switch
back to using the provided block device path, rather than the
actual target which may have been used in prior charm revisions.

Change-Id: If5e88d93b9323052ea762d3a4b66f2442d4a19be
Depends-On: If0e1fbc62bfe7d0f9e21db9bfdeee761060de846
Closes-Bug: 1782439

subject: Support immutable user source
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 15:47:02.000000000', 'message': 'Support immutable user source

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP active
directory implementation, tempest tests that try to create or delete
a user will fail. Instead of failing, we would like them to skip.
Proposed is an additional config setting in the auth group
called immutable_user_source that is defulted to false.

To handle this on a test by test basis and avoid modifying behavior
that depends on the identity base class, we propose using a
testtools decorator to skip tests based on the new config setting.

One test class so far has been adjusted to use the decorator, and if
the config setting is set to true, the tests will skip accordingly.

Partial-Bug: 1777047
Change-Id: Idc09d6272386f026a899787c2151745916a7228d

Change-Id: I7d6d4e6cd799e2d91689584a1b391c61525f9eeb
'}]
commit_message:
Support immutable user source

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP active
directory implementation, tempest tests that try to create or delete
a user will fail. Instead of failing, we would like them to skip.
Proposed is an additional config setting in the auth group
called immutable_user_source that is defulted to false.

To handle this on a test by test basis and avoid modifying behavior
that depends on the identity base class, we propose using a
testtools decorator to skip tests based on the new config setting.

One test class so far has been adjusted to use the decorator, and if
the config setting is set to true, the tests will skip accordingly.

Partial-Bug: 1777047
Change-Id: Idc09d6272386f026a899787c2151745916a7228d

Change-Id: I7d6d4e6cd799e2d91689584a1b391c61525f9eeb

commit_message:
Move neutron-fullstack-python35 out of experimental queue

The neutron-fullstack-python35 job, which is an integral part of the
python 3 community goal, is stable now.  This change moves it from the
experimental queue to the check queue, but leaves it non-voting.  Once
the Rocky release happens, we can use the additional data provided by
the extra runs and assess if it can be made voting.

Change-Id: I512094705ecbe1e470a623ada7e01c634a6d07be

commit_message:
Fix deploy health checks

Allow up to 5 minutes for unhealthy and restarting containers to stabilise.

Change-Id: Icb0ef7648920e77fe368409f07612cdcba83e4cf
Related-Bug: 1782598
(cherry picked from commit bd1d5d72caf25010e373f1ad2ed6ebc5aee96914)

commit_message:
Add disable-nouveau element to tripleo images

This ensures nouveau is not loaded at boot, as this can prevent PCI passthrough
or loading the NVIDIA binary drivers that are required for vGPU support.

Requires switching from the (now deprecated) modprobe-blacklist to the modprobe
element in the hardened images.

bp tripleo-vgpu

Depends-On: I60815de86e7b22dfb39555af9d2d53564841e2ab
Change-Id: I5d487e99b4e72368f36051509146dc75dd31b62e
Closes-bug: 1774674

commit_message:
neutron: Try to get neutron_plugin_configure_common for decomposed plugins

Run "override_defaults" and "source" phases to give decomposed
plugins a chance to load their functions and vars,
including neutron_plugin_configure_common.
(Do not run "pre-install" phase because it might have more complex
side effects for some plugins.)

Closes-Bug: #1700487
Change-Id: Iec45a33930a06b17be00e8602f2457ab6960073f

commit_message:
Fix trivial misprint

It could  be reproduced if pod vif driver which defined in kuryr.conf
vif_pool.pools_vif_drivers isn't compatible with pool vif driver.

Change-Id: I2f5b3a476bda1bd6e8d0a3d8cdd1d4de4fb3b65e
Signed-off-by: Alexey Perevalov <a.perevalov@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Remove legacy scenario multinode job for cinder

The legacy job 'legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-scenario-multinode-lvm-multibackend'
has been migrated to tempest repo as "tempest-sceanrio-all" [1].

"tempest-sceanrio-all" job runs
- all scenario tests including slow tests - same as old job
- it exclude the live migration api tests - these tests are covered
                                            by "nova-live-migration"

New job "tempest-sceanrio-all" will be added on cinder gate
by- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583842/

This commit removes the old job entry for cinder from project.yaml and
dependent patch adds the corresponding new job in cinder gate.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/.zuul.yaml#n147

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583842/
Change-Id: I353a39aba501ff45d0f04e917720d03bd2ddeac0

(1 comment)

I like this! The username/password prompt is a really great and intuitive ergonomic improvement for users who didn't care to set credentials in the environment or with the CLI switches!

The behavior of ^C during the password prompt is a little counterintuitive and disappointing (`interrupt_safe_getpass` silently takes note of it and then only handles it after getpass is done), but since it seems to be there for technical reasons to prevent even an more counterintuitive and disappointing breaking of terminal settings, I don't think it should be a merge-blocker."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2015-07-02 21:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2015-07-02 21:28:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Added some comments per Zack's suggestion. Also went back to raising KeyboardInterrupt in the overriding handler, as I don't remember why I switched away from that and *not* doing that requires that the user hit enter to get out of the prompt, even after hitting Ctrl+C."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-07-02 22:15:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

- gate-swiftclient-dsvm-functional http://logs.openstack.org/87/189387/4/check/gate-swiftclient-dsvm-functional/a4974d0/ : SUCCESS in 22m 20s'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2015-07-24 22:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(7 comments)

the spirt of that bug is about session management, the user wants the experience to be:

 * I try to use the tool and it can't auth
 * It makes me auth
 * I continue to use the tool and no longer have to AUTH

Those other clients use some crazy keystore/keychain manager dependency stuff (works on osx and most linuxes I think?)

We currently solve it with bash environment

But either way - prompting me everytime to enter my password is not what any one wants.  I think it's an anti-pattern.  Rather than encouraging me to "get my environment right" - it's encouraging me to get my environment right for auth url (probably user too?) and type my password in every command like a monkey.  That's a terrible idea - and definitely does not close the associated bug.

We should either go look at what the other clients do and do that, or do something with the auth command to interactively help the user get their environment setup in a useful way so they have a working session.

... or something else (cache a token to a file in /tmp?).'}, {'account_id': 17156, 'date': '2015-07-30 14:27:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

So using the openstack and keystone CLI as a reference, in a case where the username isn't present through the env both comments fail:

openstack user list
ERROR: openstack Missing parameter(s): 
Set a username with --os-username, OS_USERNAME, or auth.username


keystone user-list
Expecting authentication method via
  either a service token, --os-token or env[OS_SERVICE_TOKEN], 
  credentials, --os-username or env[OS_USERNAME]


The prompting takes place when only the password is missing and I think there's some benefit with this design, namely someone may not want to leave their password in the environment.

Note both keystone and openstack use the env like we do in swift (not sure if they support anything else).

I agree with Clay that ideally there would be a better way to accomplish this (e.g. through authorization service), but it seems like prompting for a password is a good idea ?

Maybe during the prompt you could also include a "to avoid this in the future set OS_PASSWORD if desired"

?'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2015-08-10 22:08:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

Seems fair to drop the user prompt; as a result, this doesn't really implement the blueprint that was linked earlier. Also added a hint when prompting for a password (except during an auth command).

Clay, I agree that using keyring would be preferable, but taking that on requires that we figure out how to uniquely identify the auth-url/os-auth-url/user-name/user-domain-name/user-domain-id/tenant-name/tenant-id/project-name/project-id/whatever-the-hell-else ball of crap. Thinking about that, I'd much rather take incremental improvements than wait for the perfect solution.

In the meantime, I think we should take the bug at face-value; *not* having passwords persisted in the clear (whether in my bash environ or on disk) is good, and prompting for a password allows us to get that. We can create another bug report for adding keyring support if that will help track this."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2015-08-10 22:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-08-10 23:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

seems there may be a regression with the auth command :

https://gist.github.com/clayg/05f13f3236e9a3f8cdfd

Not entirely sure the implications, can you attempt to confirm?  Or let me know if there's any additional information I could provide?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2016-01-15 22:51:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Clay,

In the first case, I'm not sure I'd call it a regression. We're doing a plain `swift auth` with an environment that already knows auth url, user, storage url, and auth token. So the user seems to want to renew their token; great! Keystone (for example) lets you do that with an existing token, and you provided one, so let's try it. Huh, not authorized; I guess the token has expired already. (Or we're working with an auth system that doesn't support token renewal, like tempauth.) Telling them about the 401 to let them know the token's gone bad seems no worse (to me) than telling them about the 401 to let them know their password was wrong.

(It's probably worth noting, though, that swiftclient *doesn't* currently support token renewal against Keystone; see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/172791/ to get it fixed.)

In the second case, there's certainly a bug; I'll fix it in the next patchset. But I want to point out that currently master sure looks busted; where did these two come from?

  export OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=2.0
  export OS_AUTH_VERSION=2.0

I'm not using v2 auth!"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2016-01-15 22:51:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-01-16 00:30:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 18:09:23.000000000', 'message': 'Prompt for missing username and/or password

If auth url is *also* missing, however, the familiar usage text is still
displayed.

Related change: I9bf1f70dd4cdd25467587a416df9631ed4ce980a
Closes-Bug: 1357562

commit_message:
Prompt for missing password

If auth url or user name are missing, however, the familiar usage text
is still displayed.

Related-Change: I9bf1f70dd4cdd25467587a416df9631ed4ce980a
Closes-Bug: #1357562
Co-Authored-By: John Trowbridge <trown@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I250557475ac58f9fb6c5be32435498a3e1b45235

commit_message:
import networking-cisco jobs into net-cisco tree

This patch removes the networking-cisco jobs according to the
python3-first community goal. They will now be maintained in the
networking-cisco tree.

Change-Id: Iaaf4b36a13bcbfcb9f75a3fedda8667e7527356f
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/581063

commit_message:
Setting up charm_dir() return_value on mocked hookenv
tox -e py36 fails before running any unit test for Designate Charm
TypeError happens during test discover time, where mocked hookenv.charm_dir()
is called without any return_value defined

Change-Id: I690ba91c2025ef2c6abb8f6a2b897e6889b72355
Partial-Bug: #1783765

subject: Setting up charm_dir() return_value on mocked hookenv tox -e py36 fails before running any unit test for Designate-Bind Charm TypeError happens during test discover time, where mocked hookenv.charm_dir() is called without any return_value defined Correcting single-line error for pep8 test
messages:
[{'account_id': 28510, 'date': '2018-07-26 16:02:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-07-27 09:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

As per designate-bind:

Thanks for digging into this, you saved me a lot of time trying to track down this error!

Since the charm was written a helper was added to charms.openstack to handle the mocking for reactive tests so I think you should add this fix there and convert this charm to use the shared method "charms_openstack.test_mocks.mock_charmhelpers"'}, {'account_id': 28510, 'date': '2018-07-27 13:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Setting up charm_dir() return_value on mocked hookenv
tox -e py36 fails before running any unit test for Designate-Bind Charm
TypeError happens during test discover time, where mocked hookenv.charm_dir()
is called without any return_value defined
Correcting single-line error for pep8 test

Change-Id: Ie9155a1e6d83cc618de8c6ea05c409cf7ae749a7
Partial-Bug: #1783765

commit_message:
Release python-cinderclient 4.0.0

This is the python-cinderclient release
that coincides with the Rocky release.

There are a couple of changes included that
impact the CLI and Library interfaces.  Therefore
we have made this a major version bump.

Change-Id: Ie3ddd92bcedc3604fd5e788ce1840f12a4d81542

* Hidden resources. ``OS::Aodh::Alarm`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Aodh::GnocchiAggregationByResourcesAlarm`` instead.
* ``OS::Magnum::Bay`` is now hidden, please use ``OS::Magnum::Cluster``
instead.
* ``OS::Magnum::BayModele`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Magnum::ClusterTemplate`` instead.
* ``OS::Nova::FloatingIP`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Neutron::FloatingIP`` instead.
* ``OS::Nova::FloatingIPAssociation`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Neutron::FloatingIPAssociation`` instead.

Change-Id: I2ea1400cfe1f4eca24f2fb7b4b0ec27ca5e9538d
'}, {'created': '2018-07-11 08:33:51.000000000', 'message': 'Hidden resources in Rocky

Resource type ``OS::Aodh::Alarm`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Aodh::GnocchiAggregationByResourcesAlarm`` instead. Also comment out
``AWS::CloudWatch::Alarm``, ``OS::Metering::Alarm``,
``OS::Ceilometer::Alarm`` from ``resource_registry`` in global environment,
since they all depends on ``OS::Aodh::Alarm``. Please change your template
to reference to ``OS::Aodh::GnocchiAggregationByResourcesAlarm`` instead.

Resource type ``OS::Magnum::Bay`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Magnum::Cluster`` instead.

Resource type ``OS::Magnum::BayModele`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Magnum::ClusterTemplate`` instead.

Resource type ``OS::Nova::FloatingIP`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Neutron::FloatingIP`` instead.

Resource type ``OS::Nova::FloatingIPAssociation`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Neutron::FloatingIPAssociation`` instead.

comment out ``OS::Ceilometer::CombinationAlarm`` from
``resource_registry`` in global environment, since it depends on
``OS::Aodh::CombinationAlarm`` which already been mark as hidden resource
type and provide no functionality at all.

Change-Id: I2ea1400cfe1f4eca24f2fb7b4b0ec27ca5e9538d

commit_message:
Hidden resources in Rocky

Resource type ``OS::Magnum::Bay`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Magnum::Cluster`` instead.

Resource type ``OS::Magnum::BayModele`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Magnum::ClusterTemplate`` instead.

Resource type ``OS::Nova::FloatingIP`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Neutron::FloatingIP`` instead.

Resource type ``OS::Nova::FloatingIPAssociation`` is now hidden, please use
``OS::Neutron::FloatingIPAssociation`` instead.

Change-Id: I2ea1400cfe1f4eca24f2fb7b4b0ec27ca5e9538d

Fix url_path

1. Replace /v1/deployables with /v1/accelerators/deployables.
2. Replace base_url with api_name.
3. Fix update body.

commit_message:
New preflight validation: disk space on undercloud

This validation should be called by default. In order to prevent
some inconsistency, we base that check on an ansible run from the
tripleo-validations repository.

This patch also push a new method in undercloud_preflight allowing
to run whatever ansible playbook located in the tripleo-validations
tree.

Depends-On: I71cf319270bfec50304f24a09da34d0ea8b1ecd8
Change-Id: I58ae88b911b75ca1389332831b5669e34263009b

commit_message:
Set NeutronDnsDomain for standalone

If this is not set correctly, it appears that the host file is not
properly generated resulting in CI issues.

Change-Id: Ie39bda2715e58676e74a20b1af20b35d68fd9e68
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

commit_message:
Resolve symlinks to underlying block devices

When checking for holders on a block device, ensure that any
by-uuid or by-dname provided paths are resolved to the underlying
block device when searching for holders.

Change-Id: If0e1fbc62bfe7d0f9e21db9bfdeee761060de846
Closes-Bug: 1782439

commit_message:
Fix deploy health checks

Allow up to 5 minutes for unhealthy and restarting containers to stabilise.

Change-Id: Icb0ef7648920e77fe368409f07612cdcba83e4cf
Related-Bug: 1782598

password is required, so we add it.

commit_message:
use callback payloads for ROUTER/ROUTER_GATEWAY BEFORE_DELETE events

This patch switches ROUTER/ROUTER_GATEWAY BEFORE_DELETE events to use
payload style args. It also factors vpn_callback into a
separate callback specifically for ROUTER BEFORE_DELETE events to
support both styles; the TODO in the code can be cleaned up later.

Change-Id: I68fe5583426d6fa844a2a25a21256f842e587dff
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562762

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-26 17:27:03.000000000', 'message': "build with --template-only to not require running docker service

Add a try/except check and raise excpetion if not --template-only

Reason for this is so that you can run kolla_build --template-only
on a system with a user that doesn't have permissions to access
docker or system may not have docker service running.  The template
only generation is ok because it doesn't specifically need the docker
context

Change-Id: I191f3e073d14e9ba5419a8a9b043e8afaa565e2a
"}]
commit_message:
build with --template-only to not require running docker service

Add a try/except check and raise excpetion if not --template-only

Reason for this is so that you can run kolla_build --template-only
on a system with a user that doesn't have permissions to access
docker or system may not have docker service running.  The template
only generation is ok because it doesn't specifically need the docker
context

Change-Id: I191f3e073d14e9ba5419a8a9b043e8afaa565e2a

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary test overrides

These overrides are not required for test purposes,
given that they are setting the same value as the
role defaults are doing anyway.

Change-Id: Ibe2549b05605bfc0ed201e41a79001121b52af43

"}, {'created': '2017-12-31 09:26:48.000000000', 'message': "Add a netmiko device driver for Juniper switches

The driver overrides the save_configuration method to support the Junos
transactional configuration model's commit operation.

The private configuration mode is used in order to provide a level of
isolation between sessions, and to ensure that uncommitted changes are
not left on the switch following a failure to commit the configuration.

Configuration errors are handled by ensuring that the commit operation
is successful.

A retry mechanism is used to handle temporary failures due to multiple
sessions attempting to lock the JunOS configuration database
concurrently. The retry mechanism is configured via the configuration
options 'ngs_commit_interval' and 'ngs_commit_timeout'.

commit_message:
Add a netmiko device driver for Juniper switches

The driver overrides the save_configuration method to support the Junos
transactional configuration model's commit operation.

The private configuration mode is used in order to provide a level of
isolation between sessions, and to ensure that uncommitted changes are
not left on the switch following a failure to commit the configuration.

Configuration errors are handled by ensuring that the commit operation
is successful.

A retry mechanism is used to handle temporary failures due to multiple
sessions attempting to lock the JunOS configuration database
concurrently. The retry mechanism is configured via the configuration
options 'ngs_commit_interval' and 'ngs_commit_timeout'.

Change-Id: I6e82c43887721517b543c54cf8b958b5a918bd1b
Closes-Bug: #1740587

commit_message:
Fix is_default value is empty issue when create

When we use manila client to create a share type or share group
type, the is_default value is always empty, this patch is to fix
this issue.

Depends-On: Ia8bcb632591fc0b5438847b22ec59c2039ecf5f1
Change-Id: Ib264d8422fe57701f990cbbf7ea5d1e90b8b0008
Closes-bug: #1743941

commit_message:
Fix some nits in transfer volume with snapshots

There were some nits left when we merged transfer-volume-with-snapshots.
So this patch will update them all.

1.Add CleanUp in _create_volume and _create_transfer methods.
2.Change Log.warning to Log.error.

Closes-Bug: #1783040
Change-Id: If0e246f839f268653feb1c4cecbc6a3537acde03

Activate html_static_path config option

This config option is disbaled causes some static links
cannot be found (error 404). Eg.

The link to sample policy file in:
https://docs.openstack.org/barbican/latest/sample_policy.html

commit_message:
Using fixtures instead of deprecated mockpatch module

This module mockpatch of oslotest[1] is deprecated since version 1.13
and may be removed in version 2.0. Use fixtures.Mock* classes instead[2]

[1]OpenStack Testing Framework and Utilities
[2]https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/api/oslotest.mockpatch.html#module-oslotest.mockpatch

Change-Id: I6ab2f326cecb95fa7f9e6cbb01be1b2b498abdb1

commit_message:
Setting up charm_dir() return_value on mocked hookenv

tox -e py36 fails before running any unit test for Designate-Bind Charm
TypeError happens during test discover time, where mocked hookenv.charm_dir()
is called without any return_value defined

Change-Id: Ic0454109e5353e5379e26b3d166431e259d738f0
Partial-Bug: #1783765

commit_message:
Do not install zVMCloudConnector in py36

This is causing any installs using nova in py36 to fail
and is blocking some gates.

Related-Bug: #1782604

Change-Id: I153f6297bb0b1420f9a1b314586fe030df0dac1f
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 07:49:38.000000000', 'message': 'Make instance_action_events.traceback a non-required field

instance_action_events.traceback can only be seen by admin users
with default policy.json,
"os_compute_api:os-instance-actions:events":
    "rule:admin_api or role:InstanceEvents"
so it should not be deemd as a required field in schema.
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#show-server-action-details

Change-Id: Id85c75347eba2b10b8ecc0ea262fd870281c610d
Closes-Bug: #1783275
'}]
commit_message:
Make instance_action_events.traceback a non-required field

instance_action_events.traceback can only be seen by admin users
with default policy.json,
"os_compute_api:os-instance-actions:events":
    "rule:admin_api or role:InstanceEvents"
so it should not be deemd as a required field in schema.
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#show-server-action-details

Change-Id: Id85c75347eba2b10b8ecc0ea262fd870281c610d
Closes-Bug: #1783275

commit_message:
Add instance-mtu config opt

This brings this charm inline with the neutron-gateway charm
in terms of configurability when using a local dhcp agent.

Change-Id: Idc4f7735aaa9236d8a476fd3bae6aaf52b9dc043
Closes-Bug: 1777888

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters replace
the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Add transport_url generation to conf
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory and update tests
* Install extra packages for optional drivers

Change-Id: I88fa6bd04ebad08211570d46ed464409b5896123

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters replace
the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be transparent
to the barbican service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Add transport_url generation to conf
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory
* Update tets
* Update examples
* Add release note

Change-Id: I0657c88799e06987c6df90edd55fda859faf6035

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters replace
the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be transparent
to the masakari service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation in conf
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory and update tests
* Install extra packages for optional drivers

Change-Id: I127ce216cfb7b4d5755b8f0a68406bbd251fbdd2

commit_message:
tests: Ensure clouds.yaml is present, and use it

Instead of sourcing openrc (which is so 1995), we
use clouds.yaml instead. Also, to make sure it is
there we run the role that puts it there.

Change-Id: I15769746ffbcfdc990e39dee4fb1545b564bb442

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters replace
the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Add transport_url generation to conf
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory and update tests
* Install extra packages for optional drivers

Change-Id: I96d43d5ff04254352980a2c0ba40ed7bb2e9f234

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters replace
the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Add transport_url generation to conf template
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory and update tests
* Update readme
* Install extra packages for optional drivers
* Add release note

Change-Id: Ie43bcf4c5a8414072f1917ab8b30a034a514c51b

commit_message:
Refactor RAID configuration via iRMC driver

This patch will move resume_clean() to private method for
RAID configuration. Due to previous method only mention
to RAID info update without generic method for other things.

Change-Id: Ic4146b536677b98cc7f66adba7d2e84676f1b095

commit_message:
Follow-up to improve pep8 checking with hacking

This patch will make consistency with Nova, Cinder and
other projects in openstack. It's going to rename D703
to N323.

Change-Id: I3fe63590c72b65b97f120c96f7b566a771c7087c

commit_message:
Fix usage of "|" for tests

With the more recent versions of ansible, we should now use
"is" instead of the "|" sign for the tests.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I0c541a43021e1eb15f04dbe2c48e6e8a46d58a4a

1. https://review.openstack.org/579133'}, {'account_id': 10155, 'date': '2018-07-02 14:33:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Correct me if I wrong, but it's not good to tests API calls and backend operations in one test case. AFAIK, if we have 2 modules A and B, and A used calls from B, it's a good idea to create unit tests for A mocking calls for B, and separate test for B.

That's why I try to split test_app.py for 2 different parts here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566727/"}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-07-03 10:43:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-07-04 16:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 10155, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:45:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-11 13:12:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-07-20 16:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Fix for failure of cleaning for iRMC restore_bios_config

Due to the bug [1], when there is an in-band clean step
follows an out-of-band one, an error will happen if
server is rebooted by the OOB.

This is fix for iRMC clean step restore_bios_config.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2002731

Change-Id: I2d4eecc43aca532604b3db8a11c8f14e5e62b5e6

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-11 20:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-12 06:17:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> It's not clear that we've actually established this won't work with TripleO as written?

Tripleo uploads the whole tripleo-heat-templates tree[1] to plan and the current 'overcloud' container size is ~4085588 bytes[3] (for a simple deployment without too many custom/user environments), which is way more than the default limit for max_json_body_size i.e 1048576. 

There is the option of setting it higher for Tripleo, which is done[2] (dunno why!) and continue to increase it at repo size grows, However we would be downloading lot more than what is needed and would not be efficient at all. 

> TripleO is Doing It Wrong for these purposes and will need to do more work 

Unless we change the plan management in Tripleo to ensure that it contains only the files needed and not the whole tree. 

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/blob/master/tripleoclient/workflows/plan_management.py#L39
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/environments/undercloud.yaml#L66

[3] 
(undercloud) [zuul@undercloud ~]$ openstack container show overcloud
+--------------+---------------------------------------+
| Field        | Value                                 |
+--------------+---------------------------------------+
| account      | AUTH_17c0840a8a3c4c7daa70d41363d46aa6 |
| bytes_used   | 4085588                               |
| container    | overcloud                             |
| object_count | 1010                                  |
| properties   | Usage-Tripleo='plan'                  |
+--------------+---------------------------------------+"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-12 16:01:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> There is the option of setting it higher for Tripleo, which is done[2] (dunno why!)

Now that I think about it, I seem to recall the size of the files dict (which contains just the files identified by the client as needed) in TripleO is at least 1MB. The undercloud is it's own thing though, so it's no problem to have a different limit there.

> However we would be downloading lot more than what is needed and would not be efficient at all.

I agree that this sounds excessive, although the fact that we share a copy amongst all of the nested stacks now should prevent this causing any real problems with RAM and DB space consumption.

> Unless we change the plan management in Tripleo to ensure that it contains only the files needed and not the whole tree. 

That seems not unreasonable in principle. The plan management was designed at a time that this feature did not exist in Heat (and specifically the change in heatclient to generate a convenient list of the files needed did not exist). It isn't surprising that it would need to be adjusted in order to get the best API.

I'd be interested to hear from Steve what issues there might be in practice with this. Are Jinja templates resolved before uploading the plan, for instance? (I assume they would be.)"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-07-13 09:00:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> I'd be interested to hear from Steve what issues there might be in practice with this. Are Jinja templates resolved before uploading the plan, for instance? (I assume they would be.)

I think creating a sparse plan in the swift container isn't really fixing the main problem, which is that all the referenced files need to be in a huge files map - why does it matter what files exist in the container if heat only loads those it needs (I know that's a question of implementation, but forcing the user to create a sparse container seems like a pre-optimization to me?)

We pass all the various files in the files map, when they are already stored in swift, and that's why we had to increase the request size limit on the undercloud - we pass so many nested stack templates etc that it's very easy to exceed the default limit.

To answer the other questions:

- Yes we j2 render all the things before ever calling heat, basically we render in a local tmpdir then bulk-upload the resulting directory to swift, which works fine, and sometimes it's useful to have all the files there vs only those used by heat, but we could look at sparsifying if there's an easy way to do that.

- " only the files needed and not the whole tree." is hard to do on the client side if you want to use server side environment merging I think, since you need to resolve/merge the environment, then get all the file references - Perhaps I've missed some new API that helps with this?'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-13 19:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> I think creating a sparse plan in the swift container isn't really fixing the main problem, which is that all the referenced files need to be in a huge files map - why does it matter what files exist in the container if heat only loads those it needs (I know that's a question of implementation, but forcing the user to create a sparse container seems like a pre-optimization to me?)

That's a fair point. The limit on the total files size is inherently going to make life difficult for people who are passing massive amounts of data through to software deployments. And we are absolutely contemplating it because it's an easier implementation, not because it's better for the user. But:

* We need to snapshot the data, since it could be changed by the user in Swift, and so there will always be a size limit, unless we do something like copy them to a private Swift bucket to save space in the DB. I think Rico actually wanted to do something like that. It seems like a lot of work though.
* In terms of strategic direction for Heat, I think we want to optimise more for the use case where a software deployment is more along the lines of "start this docker container" and less "run this 50,000 line shell script".
* This implementation will get done right now, in Rocky, and users can start using it. And it will likely be ~bug-free because it's so simple. Who knows how long they'll have to wait to get an optimised implementation (let alone a bug-free one)?
* As long as we get the API right, there's nothing stopping us from improving the implementation (by downloading less) later.

> To answer the other questions:

> * Yes we j2 render all the things before ever calling heat, basically we render in a local tmpdir then bulk-upload the resulting directory to swift, which works fine, and sometimes it's useful to have all the files there vs only those used by heat, but we could look at sparsifying if there's an easy way to do that.

Cool. I would be +1 for going this way then.

> * " only the files needed and not the whole tree." is hard to do on the client side if you want to use server side environment merging I think, since you need to resolve/merge the environment, then get all the file references - Perhaps I've missed some new API that helps with this?

Yep, the idea is that https://review.openstack.org/557183 will give you a list of all the files you need to upload from python-heatclient. (The same list it uses when determining what to include in the files dict now.)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-07-16 09:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> We need to snapshot the data, since it could be changed by the user in Swift

Do we really have to though?  The state of the stack won't change unless the user runs a stack update, so personally I don't think the mutable nature of the swift container is really any different to a local directory of templates?

> In terms of strategic direction for Heat, I think we want to optimise more for the use case where a software deployment is more along the lines of "start this docker container" and less "run this 50,000 line shell script".

The problem isn't only SoftwareDeployments, indeed in TripleO now we've got very few large scripts or monolithic puppet manifests etc, everything is in $many nested stack templates, which is a general problem for any environment building a large/complex deployment with several layers of nesting.

> This implementation will get done right now, in Rocky, and users can start using it. And it will likely be ~bug-free because it's so simple.

Sure, I chatted with Rabi about this, and to be clear I'm *not* blocking this implementation, more responding to your initial "why do we require the user to specify a list of files, instead of automatically getting all of the files that are referenced using a relative path?" comment with an because IMHO that would be very much nicer from an end-user persective, and it's one of the user pain points which aren't really resolved by this current first-pass.

> As long as we get the API right, there's nothing stopping us from improving the implementation (by downloading less) later.

Agreed, happy to iterate on it but it's good to discuss so we can be clear on the longer term direction :)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-17 05:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-17 09:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck story 2002978'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-18 18:58:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> > We need to snapshot the data, since it could be changed by the user in Swift

> Do we really have to though?  The state of the stack won't change unless the user runs a stack update, so personally I don't think the mutable nature of the swift container is really any different to a local directory of templates?

When we want to load the current state of the stack, we need access to all of the files. If they have changed (or worse, can't be found any more) then weird stuff will happen. That's why we store everything in the DB."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-20 04:22:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-23 06:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

It will be nice to have a release note for this:)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-23 07:07:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

> It will be nice to have a release note for this:)

Will add to the next patch in the series.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-23 07:17:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-24 05:26:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-24 06:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-24 08:53:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-25 15:35:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-25 20:56:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-26 03:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-26 04:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-27 06:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2

Would be nice if we have a functional test for this in follow up patch:)'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-07-27 08:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-12 08:08:56.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Allow to fetch child templates and env files from container

This allows for user to specify a swift container and
all child templates and env files will be fetched from the container,
if available. This would raise a server side error if any of
the required files is missing.

Note: To add tests

Change-Id: Ifa21fbcb41fcb77827997cce2d5e9266ba849b17
'}, {'created': '2018-03-13 11:02:53.000000000', 'message': "Option for retrieving child templates and env files from swift

This provides an option to specify a swift container and all
child templates and env files can be fetched from the container,
if available. However, files coming in the 'files' map from the
client will have precedence, if the same is also present in swift.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Ifa21fbcb41fcb77827997cce2d5e9266ba849b17
Partial-Bug: #1755453

commit_message:
Option for retrieving child templates and env files from swift

This provides an option to specify a swift container for stack
actions and all child templates and env files will be fetched
from the container, if available. However, files coming in the
'files' map from the client will have precedence, if the same
is also present in swift.

Change-Id: Ifa21fbcb41fcb77827997cce2d5e9266ba849b17
Story: #1755453
Task: 17353

commit_message:
Supports smart NIC feature
- LiquidIO from Cavium provides full offloading of OVS on it's NIC card.
- LiquidIO support sriov port and it uses direct port type.
- When VM with direct port is instantiated, networking-onos bind port and transmit appropriate REST msg to ONOS

Change-Id: Ia3b751dec56496318937e8a6fc4d228b5f9205f1

commit_message:
Add a compatible check before creating pool

When creating pool associated with incompatible protocol of listener,
pool will be created in the database and cannot delete it by command.
This patch add a compatible check before creating pool in database.

Change-Id: I8f749ad49e86c3d891c6965db86ae346a52f9634
Closes-Bug: #1556342
(cherry picked from commit bfee75e1b31eeb735718ac39092d9c00850d1983)

Makes sense to back-port this. This can mask issues with invalid certificates.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-25 17:25:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 09:46:27.000000000', 'message': "Log failed cert delete, and raise TLSContainerInvalid instead

It's possible that neutron can get a certificate, but not delete it. This
can cause the cert validation to raise a HTTP error instead of the
actual validation error.

This patch changes this by catching the cert_mgr error and logging it,
allowing the original error to raise properly.

Change-Id: Icd8fd77a157481e3ce19ea71749bb6e0e3940967
(cherry picked from commit 5b58a20906a13cd141d39d4684aa8c830fa174da)
"}]
commit_message:
Log failed cert delete, and raise TLSContainerInvalid instead

It's possible that neutron can get a certificate, but not delete it. This
can cause the cert validation to raise a HTTP error instead of the
actual validation error.

This patch changes this by catching the cert_mgr error and logging it,
allowing the original error to raise properly.

Change-Id: Icd8fd77a157481e3ce19ea71749bb6e0e3940967
(cherry picked from commit 5b58a20906a13cd141d39d4684aa8c830fa174da)

The old namespace driver was using, the long deprecated, appsession
option for APP_COOKIE session persistence. This fails on HAProxy 1.6

This patch moves that over to the modern stick table method.

commit_message:
Fix cookie session persistence in namespace driver

The old namespace driver was using, the long deprecated, appsession
option for APP_COOKIE session persistence. This fails on HAProxy 1.6
and later.
This patch moves that over to the modern stick table method.

Change-Id: I834958f711525c08fad12e280abc308820b20521
Story: 1640882
Task: 5321
(cherry picked from commit 1e2a93a4a5f7ca1f34bf85c9551839ee732a079d)

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky
messages: [{'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2018-07-27 08:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 15:48:48.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I592bce78ebfc4c5b7bb98673f40464ba81297a17
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I592bce78ebfc4c5b7bb98673f40464ba81297a17

commit_message:
Move remnants of environments/services-docker

Move new files, which made it into environments/services-docker.
Ensure YAML validate will not pass for environments/services-docker
any more.

Change-Id: If16cf6bdafa8e10480134d356a7d7787f1c0bd72
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 405339986060e4c851d846fdb7d5be05f43fd75e)

commit_message:
Update base image with latest security fixes

This ensures freshly built kolla images include the latest security
fixes for severity Important and above.

This was suggested by Jon Schlueter and based on the code available at
https://github.com/brianwcook/happywebserver/blob/master/Dockerfile#L27

Change-Id: Ib14f326a335d9519fb888f5486950275985a788c
(cherry picked from commit 38f18f2d1280d7429a7be45b993bb5f166f39134)

I missed this, but was this the right choice removing these files after it has been released? Released documentation, users deploying using these files, etc. will all be negatively impacted.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2018-07-09 14:32:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

here, to the new environments/services corresponding paths.

commit_message:
Delete not-used services-docker files

The services-docker env files now all reside in
services and became defaults. We need to delete those
copies to not allow desync of contents.

That is a "relaxed backport" as we also sync any changes
had been made into environments/services-docker being removed
here, to the new environments/services corresponding paths.

Change-Id: I0c343e3dd01ad864bad8c7632261c9db4b28b5df
(cherry picked from commit 6c5f2b8f69d42b2201f29264360ca15a518f376b)
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

copied from another patch(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/471039/):

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/manager.py#L4568

 4568         if image:
 4569             instance.image_ref = shelved_image_ref
 4570             self._delete_snapshot_of_shelved_instance(context, instance,    << Delete snapshot of instance >>
 4571                                                       image['id'])
 4572
 4573         self._unshelve_instance_key_restore(instance, scrubbed_keys)
 4574         self._update_instance_after_spawn(context, instance)
 4575         # Delete system_metadata for a shelved instance
 4576         compute_utils.remove_shelved_keys_from_system_metadata(instance)
 4577
 4578         instance.save(expected_task_state=task_states.SPAWNING)
 4579         self._update_scheduler_instance_info(context, instance) << Change vm_state to ACTIVE >>

At line 4570, the snapshot of an instance is deleted. After that, the vm_state is changed to ACTIVE at line 4579.
The "delete image/snapshot" API returns HTTP204 and that means "Synchronous resource deletion" from api-wg guideline.

https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/http.rst#2xx-success-codes

I am not sure the glance API matches to the guideline, but if so, the test should success always.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-06-07 16:20:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2017-06-07 16:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Avoid package upgrade collisions

During upgrade to a new cloud archive and a new rabbitmq-server
package, the package update will stop the rabbitmq service. If two or
more units do this near the same time the services will fail to restart.

This change adds the cluster_wait function before a package upgrade to
avoid collisions.

Fix relation_get for cluster_with causing extraneous hooks to execute.
Fix nagios stats collection logic.

Change-Id: I8d9aa38d917583fa45b5570eca9a78c813303e2b
Closes-Bug: #1778829
(cherry picked from commit 86edf1e5d86b97ec071578b1e910cd94b7a019e4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 07:03:35.000000000', 'message': 'Enable logging to stdout/stderr in memcached

Even though https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1776889 got fixed,
memcached is still configured to log to a file due to the way
puppet-memcached works:
- It would omit logging to a file when the logfile parameter (which has
  a default value) is set to undef
- In puppet/hiera undeffing a parameter that has a default value does
  not work: https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-5295

In fact even after the fixes from https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1776889 get included we still see the following:
[root@rhosp-ctr01 ~]# ps -ef | grep memcached
42457 44366 44342 0 10:06 ? 00:00:00 /bin/bash -c source /etc/sysconfig/memcached; /usr/bin/memcached -p ${PORT} -u ${USER} -m ${CACHESIZE} -c ${MAXCONN} $OPTIONS
42457 44385 44366 0 10:06 ? 00:00:08 /usr/bin/memcached -p 11211 -u memcached -m 16005 -c 8192 -v -l 192.168.18.11 -U 0 -t 8 >> /var/log/memcached.log 2>&1

This change depends on the following memcached PR:
https://github.com/saz/puppet-memcached/pull/99/files to work correctly.

With this patch memcached logs to stdout/err correctly:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 etc]# ps auxwfw |grep memcache
42457      37207  0.0  0.0  11680  1396 ?        Ss   19:23   0:00      |   \_ /bin/bash -c source /etc/sysconfig/memcached; /usr/bin/memcached -p ${PORT} -u ${USER} -m ${CACHESIZE} -c ${MAXCONN} $OPTIONS
42457      37224  0.0  0.0 293160  3724 ?        Sl   19:23   0:00      |       \_ /usr/bin/memcached -p 11211 -u memcached -m 5877 -c 8192 -v -l 172.16.2.14 -U 0 -X -t 2

Change-Id: I8cec029bd1f64ec1daa76a89e949e7d245580918
Closes-Bug: #1782223
(cherry picked from commit c93489cfbe29d88564add64f81832aca6f4fdaf3)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable logging to stdout/stderr in memcached

Even though https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1776889 got fixed,
memcached is still configured to log to a file due to the way
puppet-memcached works:
- It would omit logging to a file when the logfile parameter (which has
  a default value) is set to undef
- In puppet/hiera undeffing a parameter that has a default value does
  not work: https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP-5295

In fact even after the fixes from https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1776889 get included we still see the following:
[root@rhosp-ctr01 ~]# ps -ef | grep memcached
42457 44366 44342 0 10:06 ? 00:00:00 /bin/bash -c source /etc/sysconfig/memcached; /usr/bin/memcached -p ${PORT} -u ${USER} -m ${CACHESIZE} -c ${MAXCONN} $OPTIONS
42457 44385 44366 0 10:06 ? 00:00:08 /usr/bin/memcached -p 11211 -u memcached -m 16005 -c 8192 -v -l 192.168.18.11 -U 0 -t 8 >> /var/log/memcached.log 2>&1

This change depends on the following memcached PR:
https://github.com/saz/puppet-memcached/pull/99/files to work correctly.

With this patch memcached logs to stdout/err correctly:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 etc]# ps auxwfw |grep memcache
42457      37207  0.0  0.0  11680  1396 ?        Ss   19:23   0:00      |   \_ /bin/bash -c source /etc/sysconfig/memcached; /usr/bin/memcached -p ${PORT} -u ${USER} -m ${CACHESIZE} -c ${MAXCONN} $OPTIONS
42457      37224  0.0  0.0 293160  3724 ?        Sl   19:23   0:00      |       \_ /usr/bin/memcached -p 11211 -u memcached -m 5877 -c 8192 -v -l 172.16.2.14 -U 0 -X -t 2

Change-Id: I8cec029bd1f64ec1daa76a89e949e7d245580918

(cherry picked from commit c93489cfbe29d88564add64f81832aca6f4fdaf3)

commit_message:
Fix pykmip has no lower bound during validating

We will meet an issue when change something in requirements file.
And Zuul will be check and validate any above changes.

Failed logs [1]:
	ubuntu-xenial | Validating test-requirements.txt
	ubuntu-xenial | Requirement for package pykmip has no lower bound
	ubuntu-xenial | Validating doc/requirements.txt
	ubuntu-xenial | Requirement for package pykmip has no lower bound

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/12/579812/2/check/requirements-check/5005fe3/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-04_01_55_20_038653

Change-Id: I82b3b8be79745ed088f917907520f9903506a85f
