[{'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-04-27 08:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-04-27 08:39:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-04-27 14:21:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Commit message needs some enhancement.  Also, there are test failures; please use the command "tox" to run the tests locally and address the failures‚Ä¶'}, {'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-04-28 01:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry, I amend the code to as clear the test.'}, {'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-05-08 12:44:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-08 12:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-05-08 12:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sorry. It is about when the state of before change.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-05-08 14:49:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I don't see any tests.  A bug fix should include at least one regression test that would catch the reappearance of the fixed bug.

Also, I don't understand your answer to Matt Riedemann's question.  You seem to be saying that running the unit tests with Python 3.5.0, without this patch, would result in a test failure; however, Matt's pointing out that we've already been running the unit tests, with Python 3.5 and without your patch, and haven't been seeing the error.  Could you go into details about why we're not seeing the error?  (That'll probably guide the creation of the test I ask for above.)"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-08 18:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Correct. I can run "tox -e py35" without this change and everything passes so I don't understand why we need this, unless we just don't have coverage for this function, but if that's the case, then you should add a test for it to show the bug.'}, {'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-05-09 01:19:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thank you for comment.
But, I think you should execute the 'tox -e py35' using the Python 3.5.0.
When you execute 'tox -e py35', maybe you use the Python 3.5.1 or more.

Python 3.5.0 has different from other versions(python 3.5.1 or more) the behavior of the traceback.
This problem is only python 3.5.0. It doesn't matter python3.5.1 or more.

So the user who doesn't use python 3.5.0 user has no problem.
they have succeeded the unit test.
CI is using python 3.5.1, so the unit-test is succeeded.
https://packages.ubuntu.com/en/xenial/python3"}, {'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-05-09 05:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-05-09 05:11:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

If you execute 'tox -e py35' using python 3.5.0, maybe you will get the result like below.

$ python --version
Python 3.5.0
$ git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/python-novaclient

$ tox -e py35
... skip ...

======
Totals
======
Ran: 2130 tests in 17.2834 sec.
 - Passed: 1937
 - Skipped: 0
 - Expected Fail: 0
 - Unexpected Success: 0
 - Failed: 193
Sum of execute time for each test: 42.2270 sec.

==============
Worker Balance
==============
 - Worker 0 (524 tests) => 0:00:09.662297
 - Worker 1 (535 tests) => 0:00:12.682557
 - Worker 2 (543 tests) => 0:00:11.122140
 - Worker 3 (528 tests) => 0:00:11.684435
ERROR: InvocationError for command '/bin/bash tools/pretty_tox.sh ' (exited with code 1)
_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ summary _________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
ERROR:   py35: commands failed"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-05-09 13:47:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

So, it sounds like this change is about working around a bug in a single Python version release.  TBH, I think I'd rather we document the incompatibility with 3.5.0, as we'll never be able to create a test that demonstrates the bug, and so someone will eventually try to simplify the code.

That said, -1 just because this is still missing that regression test‚Ä¶"}, {'account_id': 15637, 'date': '2018-05-10 05:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-05-11 11:01:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sorry, I don't change the behavior. So, I think Unit-Test doesn't need to add the test case.

Currently, This bug is only Python3.5.0. But Another version(python3.6.5 or later) is likely to occur it too.
if you took the solution that 'I think I'd rather we document the incompatibility with 3.5.0' and If it occurs,
you have to write the comment 'the incompatibility with 3.x.x' every time.
So, I think that `traceback.extract_stack()[-4]` is not good.
The cause of the bug in current approach is '-4'.

But, My way isn't likely to occur it.
Because This change is referring to the argument of `func`. 
And This change doesn't need the comment it.

> So, it sounds like this change is about working around a bug in a
 > single Python version release.  TBH, I think I'd rather we document
 > the incompatibility with 3.5.0, as we'll never be able to create a
 > test that demonstrates the bug, and so someone will eventually try
 > to simplify the code.
 > 
 > That said, -1 just because this is still missing that regression
 > test‚Ä¶"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-05-11 12:34:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Well, one, you've proposed this as a bug fix.  If there's a bug, then, if possible, we need a regression test for that bug.  That regression test should fail on Python 3.5.0 without your fix, and should pass with your fix.  This seems quite possible to me, so I want to see a regression test included with this change.

Two, the fact that this occurred only with Python 3.5.0 suggests to me that there was a bug in 3.5.0 that was fixed in 3.5.1, unless you can show me something from the Python developers saying that the behavior will be reintroduced in the future.  Thus, I'm not 100% convinced that a fix is necessary, and I'd suggest some form of write-up indicating that users of novaclient should avoid 3.5.0.  Since 3.5.0 is an old release by now, just documenting it somewhere (in the bug report, say) should be sufficient.  That doesn't mean, by the way, that I'm opposed to this fix; my current -1 is just for the fact that this change, as currently proposed, lacks a regression test.  If you were to add a proper regression test, I would change my vote to +2."}, {'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-05-11 14:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The current test cases are failing on Python 3.5.0 without my fix...
Did you execute the test on Python 3.5.0?'}, {'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-05-11 14:20:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If you executed the test on Python 3.5.0 without my fix, you got this likely result.

$ tox -e py35
... skip ...

======
Totals
======
Ran: 2130 tests in 17.2834 sec.
 - Passed: 1937
 - Skipped: 0
 - Expected Fail: 0
 - Unexpected Success: 0
 - Failed: 193'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-06-05 09:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

hi Takahito and Team.

I could not validate the issue myself (have only py3.5.5 env), so I checked changelog of python 3.5 releases.
The issue is valid and here is it - https://bugs.python.org/issue25108

Despite the fact that issue is confirmed in python upstream, I strongly believe that we should not take care of old minor releases of python and suggest to use the latest one. Updating the installed python should solve the issue'}, {'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-06-06 02:57:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think too. I'm always using Python 3.5.5 or more.
I think that most important part of this is that specifying with magic number might cause a problem not only in Python 3.5 but in other future releases in Python.
This code can be used even if what magic number points in the traceback array have been changed."}, {'account_id': 28140, 'date': '2018-07-27 08:24:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-27 08:39:07.000000000', 'message': "modified novaclient/api_versions.py
When using python 3.5.0, [- 4] can not take information.
Necessary information is in the [-5].
Because it better is using 'for loops'.

Change-Id: Ic2463fc2ec5c26d1f3375f635455c9d2438f27cf
"}, {'created': '2018-05-08 12:44:47.000000000', 'message': "api_version decorator becomes an error in Python 3.5.0.

I changed that how to get the module name from `func` arguments.
_get_function_name method needs the full function name which
includes module name, owner name(optional) and just function name.
So I don't change the program operation.
If you use the python 3.5.0 you got the failure of the unit test.
Only python3.5.0 has the full function name in not traceback.extract_stack()[-4]
but traceback.extract_stack()[-5].

Closes-Bug: #1767272
Change-Id: Ic2463fc2ec5c26d1f3375f635455c9d2438f27cf
"}, {'created': '2018-05-09 05:04:34.000000000', 'message': 'api_version decorator becomes an error in Python 3.5.0.

This change the behavior of `_get_ function_name` has not changed.
I have changed that how to get the module name from `func` arguments.

If you use the python 3.5.0 you got the failure of the unit test.
Python 3.5.0 has different from other versions(python 3.5.1 or more) the behavior of the traceback.
Only python3.5.0 has the full function name in not traceback.extract_stack()[-4]
but traceback.extract_stack()[-5].

Closes-Bug: #1767272
Change-Id: Ic2463fc2ec5c26d1f3375f635455c9d2438f27cf
'}]
commit_message:
api_version decorator becomes an error in Python 3.5.0.

This change the behavior of `_get_ function_name` has not changed.
I have changed that how to get the module name from `func` arguments.

If you use the python 3.5.0 you got the failure of the unit test.
Python 3.5.0 has different from other versions(python 3.5.1 or more) the behavior of the traceback.
Only python3.5.0 has the full function name in not traceback.extract_stack()[-4]
but traceback.extract_stack()[-5].

Closes-Bug: #1767272
Change-Id: Ic2463fc2ec5c26d1f3375f635455c9d2438f27cf

commit_message:
Reword release note to use style of other notes

This patch also updates the link to keystoneauth1 code to use
git.openstack.org and point to a specific tag (I picked 3.4.0 which is
our lower constraint), so the link remains valid even if http.py is
renamed or deleted in future versions.

Change-Id: I08f8d82316e30a93ea431b070c70a348729bdc14

subject: Remap target device paths to provided paths
messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-07-24 16:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-07-27 08:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nNot needed - ceph-osd will deal with remap directly on upgrade.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 16:39:03.000000000', 'message': 'Remap target device paths to provided paths

Prior versions of the ceph-osd charm resolved symlinks to
target devices, and recorded the target device in the unit
storage list used to skip previously processed devices.

Under certain storage solutions, the target device path is
not consistent between reboots, whereas the provided path
may be - for example in MAAS managed bcache:

 /dev/bcacheX:
     changes between reboots
 /dev/disk/by-dname/bcacheX:
     udev managed and consistent

Ensure that any prior execution where the target device
was recorded are updated with the end-user provided
by-XXXX path, ensuring block device processing is safe
between reboots.

Change-Id: I8b49725534c5fee3f814f70002164333efbcfe02
Closes-Bug: 1782439
'}]
commit_message:
Remap target device paths to provided paths

Prior versions of the ceph-osd charm resolved symlinks to
target devices, and recorded the target device in the unit
storage list used to skip previously processed devices.

Under certain storage solutions, the target device path is
not consistent between reboots, whereas the provided path
may be - for example in MAAS managed bcache:

 /dev/bcacheX:
     changes between reboots
 /dev/disk/by-dname/bcacheX:
     udev managed and consistent

Ensure that any prior execution where the target device
was recorded are updated with the end-user provided
by-XXXX path, ensuring block device processing is safe
between reboots.

Change-Id: I8b49725534c5fee3f814f70002164333efbcfe02
Closes-Bug: 1782439

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables in place of the rabbitmq
values. Note that the role does not currently generate the transport
urls for rpc and notify messaging communications.

This patch:
* Update tests

Change-Id: I9f68622efa7b60d17ff565a625990005e9d1e252

subject: Move MQ vhost/user creation into role
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-17 21:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-17 21:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-27 08:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nBlazar does not appear to use rabbitmq'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:02:29.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- blazar_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- blazar_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: Ia886b752057bd20f08b0ae8f37d25cce3a0948a0
"}]
commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- blazar_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- blazar_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: Ia886b752057bd20f08b0ae8f37d25cce3a0948a0

commit_message:
Remove key "l7_policies" in pool dict

It will update pool when creating healthmonitor.
But we only need to update healthmonitor_id, and don't
care about others, so remove irrespective keys.

Change-Id: If10c2b46b9cd237496be21f4e7b2df644a76390a
Closes-Bug: #1733884
(cherry picked from commit 477d59b670504f419db12ee46556024c34ca2f2e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-04 14:39:34.000000000', 'message': 'Bifrost: set TFTP cache master path properly

Ironic creates hardlinks between the TFTP master image store and the
HTTP root path when iPXE is enabled. With Docker volumes used for these
locations we run into https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1507894
during deployment. If we use a directory under /httpboot to store the
master images this issue is avoided.

This change uses the new bifrost config variable,
ironic_tftp_master_path added in [1] to configure the path, rather than
the existing hacked approach of modifying the ironic.conf config file
after the bifrost_deploy container has started.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577071

Change-Id: I5c62999c4956bebd0d3920d756ce67ba194b0ebe

commit_message:
Bifrost: set TFTP cache master path properly

Ironic creates hardlinks between the TFTP master image store and the
HTTP root path when iPXE is enabled. With Docker volumes used for these
locations we run into https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1507894
during deployment. If we use a directory under /httpboot to store the
master images this issue is avoided.

This change uses the new bifrost config variable,
ironic_tftp_master_path added in [1] to configure the path, rather than
the existing hacked approach of modifying the ironic.conf config file
after the bifrost_deploy container has started.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577071

Change-Id: I5c62999c4956bebd0d3920d756ce67ba194b0ebe

Witold, thanks for championing for this feature, I really appreciate it. Unfortunately, I don't have time to give it the TLC that it needs right now. The notification patch at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/434537/ needs to be refactored to mirror the olso CONF that is now in the notification engine. All three patches including the API one at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/466403/ and the client one at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/466114/ need to be retested to make sure that they still work after sitting there for so long. Until the three above patches are ready to go again, I think we should revert this one because it doesn't make sense to have a partially implemented feature in the API."}]

commit_message:
Support CLI for group, silence, and inhibit rule

The new rules will also have tags on the alarm that
should be queryable.

Story: 2000935
Task: 4691

Depends-On: I3509be99311e98031ffb985b8cd6f1c1562ecbd5
Change-Id: I19f9ca4486682b50342420e82c1e8461145ec274

commit_message:
Modify Notification Engine to allow inhibit, silence, and group

Some pipeline changes are necessary to make inhibition, silencing,
and grouping possible including the addition of a new rule object,
a notification manager, a rule engine, and a rule processor.

Partially-Implements: blueprint alarm-inhibition
Partially-Implements: blueprint alarm-silencing
Partially-Implements: blueprint alarm-grouping
Story: 2000939
Task: 4063

Change-Id: I3c12c3737ddac064ee2665b6e79369c7613cbea9

[{'created': '2017-10-03 16:52:13.000000000', 'message': 'Remove scsi-target-utils from centos source packages

We already remove it for the list of binary packages.  When attempting to build
an image from source, scsi-target-utils will fail to install.

Change-Id: I1a3d3cfe55e8b6f7099856470d3759b534c672be

commit_message:
Remove scsi-target-utils from centos source packages

We already remove it for the list of binary packages.  When attempting to build
an image from source, scsi-target-utils will fail to install.

Change-Id: I1a3d3cfe55e8b6f7099856470d3759b534c672be
Implements: blueprint tripleo-ui-undercloud-container

subject: Use --force when checking out commits
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-25 14:24:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-25 21:07:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Fast approving this as we need it to get the openstackdocstheme release out.

I'll continue to try to work out what has changed since we released 1.21.0 as this wasn't a problem then.  I suspect Doug will just know but sometimes a little digging is fun."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-26 05:42:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

/me gives up.  I can't work out why this is problem now but wasn't on May 30th when we released 1.21.0"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-26 07:55:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> /me gives up.  I can't work out why this is problem now but wasn't
 > on May 30th when we released 1.21.0

This is a result of a new pbr/reno integration and the new validation step that tries to build an sdist.

At http://logs.openstack.org/46/585646/1/check/openstack-tox-validate/aebb6aa/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-25_13_35_19_938879 when the sdist is being written, the release notes file is also written. There is no entry for that file in the .gitignore list, so it causes this issue.

I'm inclined to consider that a problem with the .gitignore package and preserve the error, but it looks like we already approved the fix in the validation code so that's fine."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-26 08:02:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > /me gives up.  I can't work out why this is problem now but
 > wasn't
 > > on May 30th when we released 1.21.0
 > 
 > This is a result of a new pbr/reno integration and the new
 > validation step that tries to build an sdist.
 > 
 > At http://logs.openstack.org/46/585646/1/check/openstack-tox-validate/aebb6aa/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-25_13_35_19_938879
 > when the sdist is being written, the release notes file is also
 > written. There is no entry for that file in the .gitignore list, so
 > it causes this issue.
 > 
 > I'm inclined to consider that a problem with the .gitignore package
 > and preserve the error, but it looks like we already approved the
 > fix in the validation code so that's fine.

https://review.openstack.org/585985 should address the problem.

The other factor that caused trouble was that the theme repo used to have a RELEASENOTES.rst file that was maintained by hand, so git knew about that file and checking out an old version may have really caused a conflict."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-27 06:09:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > /me gives up.  I can't work out why this is problem now but
 > wasn't
 > > on May 30th when we released 1.21.0
 > 
 > This is a result of a new pbr/reno integration and the new
 > validation step that tries to build an sdist.

Okay, I must have messed something up, I tried checking out the releases repo from May 30th, and creating a new 1.21.2 tag in openstackdocstheme and it still failed in the same way and as such I ruled out code changes in openstack/releases from causing the problem.

 > At http://logs.openstack.org/46/585646/1/check/openstack-tox-validate/aebb6aa/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-25_13_35_19_938879
 > when the sdist is being written, the release notes file is also
 > written. There is no entry for that file in the .gitignore list, so
 > it causes this issue.
 > 
 > I'm inclined to consider that a problem with the .gitignore package
 > and preserve the error, but it looks like we already approved the
 > fix in the validation code so that's fine.

I agree and if this had been earlier in the cycle that's what I would have suggested.  We can reasonably easily revert this once we open for stein."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-27 06:33:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > > /me gives up.  I can't work out why this is problem now but
 > > wasn't
 > > > on May 30th when we released 1.21.0
 > >
 > > This is a result of a new pbr/reno integration and the new
 > > validation step that tries to build an sdist.
 > 
 > Okay, I must have messed something up, I tried checking out the
 > releases repo from May 30th, and creating a new 1.21.2 tag in
 > openstackdocstheme and it still failed in the same way and as such
 > I ruled out code changes in openstack/releases from causing the
 > problem.

You would have needed to have reno installed when you ran the validation step. I don't know if the requirements for the releases repo causes that to happen. We may want to add that.

 > > At http://logs.openstack.org/46/585646/1/check/openstack-tox-validate/aebb6aa/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-25_13_35_19_938879
 > > when the sdist is being written, the release notes file is also
 > > written. There is no entry for that file in the .gitignore list,
 > so
 > > it causes this issue.
 > >
 > > I'm inclined to consider that a problem with the .gitignore
 > package
 > > and preserve the error, but it looks like we already approved the
 > > fix in the validation code so that's fine.
 > 
 > I agree and if this had been earlier in the cycle that's what I
 > would have suggested.  We can reasonably easily revert this once we
 > open for stein.

Nah, it's fine."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-27 06:48:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> You would have needed to have reno installed when you ran the
 > validation step. I don't know if the requirements for the releases
 > repo causes that to happen. We may want to add that.

Okay.  I think I did because I deliberately picked the pbr and reno that were in constraints on May 30th.

/me shrugs."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 14:24:30.000000000', 'message': 'Use --force when checking out commits

The clone_repo script clones the repo if needed and then checks out the
commit, branch, or master. If a previous checkout has left untracked
files, this will fail to protect those files from being overwritten.

In our automation we do not need to care about untracked files and need
to make sure we have the right point in the tree, so force the checkout
to make sure these untracked files are ignored.

Change-Id: Ia1ec2869aa7a899e987ef43a11f0af627efeea65
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use --force when checking out commits

The clone_repo script clones the repo if needed and then checks out the
commit, branch, or master. If a previous checkout has left untracked
files, this will fail to protect those files from being overwritten.

In our automation we do not need to care about untracked files and need
to make sure we have the right point in the tree, so force the checkout
to make sure these untracked files are ignored.

Change-Id: Ia1ec2869aa7a899e987ef43a11f0af627efeea65
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Add get/create/delete resource provider
messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-26 11:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-26 11:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-26 12:13:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-27 07:05:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-06-28 03:37:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I feel a bit confused to see a lot of "WIP" patches in the list. To my understand, pushing WIP patches are allowed for the following cases:

* Work has not completed but need to start discussion or needs feedbacks.
* To test the gate.

If not, it's better to push your patches after completing your work. thanks'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-28 05:02:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@hiroaki
I've uploaded these series to let cores and non-cores know that I have started working on this and these are ready for getting some feedback. But I wanted to hold off these patch not to be merged before I test locally that this can actually create/delete resource providers...so I have had WIP labels on them.

Anyway, sorry for not being clear and if this confuses cores, that's not my intent. I'll hold patches locally."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-29 04:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-29 04:44:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Hiroaki and everyone
Removed WIP tag from all the patches on this branch because I tested this branch with a script found in [1].
[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/724564/

It's worth mentioning that two facts were found that we should take care about later.
1. Duplicate names of resource providers are not accepted.
2. Lower characters and hyphens("-") are not accepted for resource classes' names.

-thanks!
Tetsuro'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-07-02 04:42:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Do you have a plan to implement Blazar-use Placement client as its subclass or another way?  This series of three patch look just Placement client, not BLAZAR placement client.  As we're doing in util.openstack.nova.py, Blazar specific Placement operations should be encapsulated in this BlazarPlacementClient.

For example, create_host_provider(host_rp_id) creates a new resource provider named BLAZAR_host-provider-id.  associate_provider_class(host_rp_id, custom_class_id) associates its nested resource provider to the custom_class_id."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-12 08:50:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-13 06:33:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-07-17 10:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-22 09:09:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-07-23 05:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-23 05:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-23 11:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-07-24 05:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-24 11:44:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-07-27 05:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Remove Images API v1 entry points

This change removes option to configure Images API v1
This change removes Images API v1 endpoints from the router
This change removes all v1 tests
This change removes the v1 dependant glance-cache-manage command

This change does not remove all v1 codebase. Further cleanup and
decoupling will be needed.

Change-Id: Ia086230cc8c92f7b7dfd5b001923110d5bc55d4d

commit_message:
Add Blazar client plugin to Heat

Add a Blazar client plugin which will be used by a couple of Balazar
resources under development.

Task: 19754
Story: 2002085

subject: Mark some drivers as unstable schema or unofficial
messages:
[{'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-25 20:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-07-26 05:27:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Please confirm my comments. I think you mean backward compatible'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-26 05:32:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Akhil!

In both cases I mean backwards-incompatible, hence the warning. Normally we keep drivers schemas backwards compatible. But with monasca and vitrage webhooks I feel the schema may experience greater changes because we're still exploring in some ways as we continue with integration. Hence the special warning that they are unstable schemas. We'll still try to be backwards compatible, but there's just a greater chance it won't work out that way..."}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-07-26 05:43:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-07-26 05:46:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Got your point!'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-26 05:46:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-26 05:48:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Oh ok. Appreciate the effort to clarify and make sure we're on the same page!"}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-26 05:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-26 15:09:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-26 16:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Hold off non-featureful patch until after Rocky-3 to avoid bogging down CI resources.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-07-27 01:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

resurrect now that R-3 is past.'}]

commit_message:
Mark some drivers as unstable schema or unofficial

Warn user that some new drivers have unstable schemas that can
change in future releases.
Unofficial drivers are those that interface with third party services
but are not tested in CI.

Change-Id: Ib5ded08166995a46ed21df9e7dc81fc503d41783

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 06:14:03.000000000', 'message': "Move creating server group from resource_setup to setUp

After microversion 2.13 'project_id' and 'user_id' are added to
the body of server group, but in resource_setup microversion is
not used, so server group created in resource_setup doesn't contain
'project_id' and 'user_id', which will cause MismatchError:
MismatchError: !=:
reference = {u'id': u'09b0b4e0-d886-4bb9-9193-6faab4f0cbc8',
 u'members': [],
 u'metadata': {},
 u'name': u'tempest-ServerGroupTestJSON-Server-Group-1629494857',
 u'policies': [u'affinity']}
actual = {u'id': u'09b0b4e0-d886-4bb9-9193-6faab4f0cbc8',
 u'members': [],
 u'metadata': {},
 u'name': u'tempest-ServerGroupTestJSON-Server-Group-1629494857',
 u'policies': [u'affinity'],
 u'project_id': u'8f3f6b0bd14047b68d267d58909c8f43',
 u'user_id': u'fb05421f04cb46bd81873c4fc314ed7f'}

This is to move the creating of common server group from
resource_setup to setUp, so that microversion can be used.

Change-Id: I94c6b8276c413839cda019e5d702f26bf1acb110
Closes-Bug: #1783258
"}, {'created': '2018-07-25 01:30:42.000000000', 'message': "Move creating server group from resource_setup to setUp

 u'name': u'tempest-ServerGroupTestJSON-Server-Group-1629494857',

commit_message:
Move creating server group from resource_setup to setUp

After microversion 2.13 'project_id' and 'user_id' are added to
the body of server group, but in resource_setup microversion is
not used, so server group created in resource_setup doesn't contain
'project_id' and 'user_id', which will cause MismatchError:
MismatchError: !=:
reference = {u'id': u'09b0b4e0-d886-4bb9-9193-6faab4f0cbc8',
 u'members': [],
 u'metadata': {},
 u'name': u'tempest-ServerGroupTestJSON-Server-Group-1629494857',
 u'policies': [u'affinity']}
actual = {u'id': u'09b0b4e0-d886-4bb9-9193-6faab4f0cbc8',
 u'members': [],
 u'metadata': {},
 u'name': u'tempest-ServerGroupTestJSON-Server-Group-1629494857',
 u'policies': [u'affinity'],
 u'project_id': u'8f3f6b0bd14047b68d267d58909c8f43',
 u'user_id': u'fb05421f04cb46bd81873c4fc314ed7f'}

This is to move the creating of common server group from
resource_setup to setUp, so that microversion can be used.

Change-Id: I94c6b8276c413839cda019e5d702f26bf1acb110
Closes-Bug: #1783258

commit_message:
Skip verifying empty devices in test_tagged_attachment until bug is fixed

We have a non-trivial amount of failures due to bug 1775947 [1]
and so far attempts at debugging the issue haven't proved
fruitful, so let's skip the last (problematic) portion of the
test until we can get a recreate with proper debug to help
isolate the problem.

Related nova debug patch: https://review.openstack.org/584032

[1] http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/#1775947

Change-Id: I3104041cb66f912727aabd6c5894600dc87a1229
Related-Bug: #1775947

commit_message:
Remove deprecated option [ipmi]retry_timeout

The option [ipmi]retry_timeout is deprecated at Pike, now it's time
to remove it from the tree.

Change-Id: I921661db2a6f0c85e717e1a80e5f0c8b6c91d369
Story: #2003028
Task: #23052

commit_message:
Move usage from deprecated Ceilometer API to Gnocchi API

This removes usage of deprecated Ceilometer API

1. Changing trigger type from "OS::Ceilometer::Alarm"
to "OS::Aodh::GnocchiAggregationByResourcesAlarm"
2. Add "resource_type" fixed with value "instance"
3. Change some paramters (meter_name-> metric,
statistic ->aggregation_method, period-> granularity)
4. Change value from "average" to "mean" in method to
compare to the threshold

Change-Id: I486c14cbc9d05a0e826bbef1ad181bdcb2d8c951
Closes-Bug: #1735484

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 02:39:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add line for PyCharm IDE in gitignore file

There was no entry in the gitignore file for JetBrains IDEs like PyCharm.
This patch adds an entry to ignore the .idea directory that is created
when the masakari tree is imported as a project into PyCharm.

Change-Id: Ia5665f398e64a608e90625e3bc804cb20a141d30
'}]
commit_message:
Add line for PyCharm IDE in gitignore file

There was no entry in the gitignore file for JetBrains IDEs like PyCharm.
This patch adds an entry to ignore the .idea directory that is created
when the masakari tree is imported as a project into PyCharm.

Change-Id: Ia5665f398e64a608e90625e3bc804cb20a141d30

Address nits in strict-two-level implementation

There were a couple really minor things that needed to be addressed
in:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580331/

This patch addresses those issues.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 02:09:40.000000000', 'message': 'Temporarily disable port binding flows for live migration

While working on the port binding unbound race bug, we can
temporarily disable the flow to get things through the gate
during Rocky feature freeze and hopefully get this fixed
before Rocky RC1.

Change-Id: I7a5964902f6cd6bfb3ad2577cc02df700b359481
Related-Bug: #1783917
'}]
commit_message:
Temporarily disable port binding flows for live migration

While working on the port binding unbound race bug, we can
temporarily disable the flow to get things through the gate
during Rocky feature freeze and hopefully get this fixed
before Rocky RC1.

Change-Id: I7a5964902f6cd6bfb3ad2577cc02df700b359481
Related-Bug: #1783917
